items.content:
The Role

A tenacious, passionate and talented Software Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is required to join a well established, expanding and innovative Software House in the idyllic setting of Pembrokeshire. As the Software Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you will join a multi skilled Web Applications Team and be involved in maintaining, extending and improving website framework, designed for re-use across multiple stores and sales channels. As well as this, you will be building brand new web applications from the ground up. This role has the potential to be within a leadership capacity, dependent on your experience and you will be provided with lots of opportunity to grow.

As the Software Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you'll collaborate with colleagues, clients and other vendors to work out the best solutions to the ever-changing needs of a growing client base whilst working to keep them at the cutting edge of technology. Within your role as Software Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript).

Are you an Object Orientated Developer that posses transferable, good developer skills?

Are you the person that will be continually 'playing with' things, to ensure that you are using the best one for the task at hand? You will have the opportunity to expand your knowledge and experience in new and exciting technologies that you are interested in through lots of R&D time - specifically in the following technologies: NodeJS, React or Vue.


Role Essentials


  • Experience using OOP.
  • Experience working with PHP Frameworks, eg. Laravel, Symfony, Zend
  • You have a deep understanding of object oriented programming and design patterns
  • You know HTML inside out and have worked with some HTML APIs
  • Experience working with Cloud Tchnologies including AWS
  • You're comfortable with CSS and have experience with pre-processors eg. SASS
  • Commercial experience working on large scale projects where you have shown good decision making

Role Desirables

  • eCommerce and Payment Gateways
  • NodeJS experience
  • Javascript Frameworks, eg. AngularJS, React
  • Automated testing
  • Caching systems, eg. Memcached, Redis
  • Degree in Computer Science - recent graduates welcome

The Company

An award-winning, successful and friendly place to work, where you are given a good degree of autonomy to design and develop solutions. Teams collaborate and share ideas freely, and hierarchy and bureaucracy is kept to a minimum. In addition to the technical stuff, you'll collaborate with your peers, clients, and other vendors to work out solutions, find the quick wins, and diagnose problems.

As well as a generous salary offering you will receive benefits such as flexible working hours, remote working options, unlimited tea and coffee, onsite canteen, free lunch every Friday, state of the art hardware and the opportunity to take part in regular hackathons, plus much more!


Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) - PEMBROKE - + Additional benefits package including flexible working hours, Remote working, progression scheme, Healthcare, Annual Hackathons

items.title: Remote Lead Developer - Philadelphia
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=4, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=42, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
A Philly based Tech company is looking to bring on a Lead Developer to their team. You will be working on a new platform used by other Fortune 500 companies for feedback and more effective communication to improve business processes. This company is based out of Philadelphia but is offering a remote role, given that you are able to meet with the team in Philly twice a month.

This role has a strong emphasis on full-stack development. The ideal candidate has extensive experience with PHP / Laravel / Symfony and JavaScript. This role will allow you to introduce a modern JavaScript framework on the front end. They are looking for someone who will be able to lead their team of developers and oversee the company's development as a whole. This person should be very passionate about coding and ready to jump in head first.

Required Skills & Experience
  • PHP / Laravel / Symfony
  • Extensive experience with JavaScript
  • Ability to lead a team and manage/mentor junior developers
Desired Skills & Experience
  • React/Reactive Native is a plus
  • Any modern JavaScript framework experience
What You Will Be Doing

Tech Breakdown

  • 100% Full Stack

Daily Responsibilities

  • 70% Hands On
  • 30% Management
The Offer
  • Competitive Salary: Up to $150K/year, DOE

You will receive the following benefits:

  • Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA)
  • 401(k)
  • Paid Sick Time Leave
  • Pre-tax Commuter Benefit
  • Remote Opportunity

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future.

Jobspring Partners, part of the Motion Recruitment network, provides IT Staffing Solutions (Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Direct Hire) in major North American markets. Our unique expertise in today's highest demand tech skill sets, paired with our deep networks and knowledge of our local technology markets, results in an exemplary track record with candidates and clients.

items.content: Launched in 2018, Alto gives individual investors the ability to access and execute investments in alternative assets, such as private companies, real estate, and marketplace loans, using their retirement savings. The firm s cost-effective and hassle-free platform streamlines the process for companies, funds, borrowers, and investment platform partners to include IRA investors in their offerings. Alto s current investment partners include: AngelList, Carofin, Groundfloor, Republic, Silicon Prairie, Wefunder, and YieldStreet. AltoIRA is looking for an extremely talented PHP Developer to assist in a variety of ongoing projects. You must have deep knowledge and experience with Laravel and Vue.js, and be highly motivated and team oriented. This role will work remotely, unless you're in the Nashville area, you'll have the option to work out of our office. You will be joining a dynamic and quickly growing fintech start-up. We re looking for someone with 5 years of professional experience in PHP. This person needs to be ready to take on the level of work and organization of a senior developer, whether it be helping guide other developers or taking on large-scale projects. We are also looking for someone with experience in Laravel (or similar framework like Symfony): We need someone who is a Laravel guru and is well versed in the best practices for the framework so we can hit the ground running. You must also p lay well with othersin a small business, there s no room for egos. We try to keep the work environment relaxed and easy going. - provided by Dice

items.title: WordPress Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=41, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
WordPress Developer

Remote

freelance

“X-Team provides high-performing, on-demand teams of developers for leading brands.”

X-Team is a 100% remote international company, originally founded in Melbourne, Australia. We help companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary teams of developers from around the world.

We believe in living a life of freedom that allows you to spend more time getting energized by your passions. We’ve fostered a unique, active lifestyle and culture around this idea that continues to attract thousands of developers to apply every day. Our community is the most energizing community for developers in the world.

What separates us from our competition is the level of attention and care we give our developers compared to other more “talent”-based solutions. We proactively support them, fund their learning and growth, connect them in roaming hacker houses around the world, and give them a remote environment that motivates and inspires them on a daily basis. While other companies simply place and drop their talent, we foster and cater to our unified teams of developers centered around the same beliefs, values and lifestyle.

We’re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age and aid them in being able to do so properly with the right people.

About You:
  • Professional experience with WordPress, PHP 5 and MySQL
  • MVC frameworks like Symfony2 or Laravel are a plus
  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery
  • Ability to build and consume RESTful web services.
  • Competent with revision control systems (Git)
  • Code optimization and performance improvements
  • Knowledge of common Design Patterns (SOLID)
  • Passionate about writing beautiful and clean code
Nice to have:
  • Experience working remotely
  • Familiar/involved with open source projects
  • Experience with continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) environment
  • Experience with a backend language/framework (e.g. Node, Python, Go, PHP)
Personal:
  • Independent, self-motivated
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken
  • Proven track record of always learning and growing.
  • Proactive attitude
  • Possess a spirit of generosity
Perks:
  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games (League of Legends), Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., Coinbase (#1 crypto exchange), BeachBody (#1 fitness company), etc.
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.
  • Be part of the most energizing community for developers in the world by participating in our Seasons, a 3-month experience filled with challenges, rewards, games, competitions, and more, all centered around a theme that will inspire and energize you.
  • Get $2,500 per year (Unleash+) to spend on doing more of what you love and staying energized. Use it on conferences, courses, video games, photography equipment, a gym membership, adventure sports, baby/pet sitting, productivity apps, restaurants, coworking, headphones, etc. #NeverStopExploring
FAQ:

Who is X-Team meant for?

Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you’ve worked with freelancing platforms before, that’s not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we’ve created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated and energized than they’ve ever been.

Apply for this job ↬

Interactive agency based in mid-town Manhattan - we've spent close to 20 years developing custom software, eCommerce sites, intranets, and websites to diverse clients ranging from startups to fortune 500 companies. Looking for a lead developer to join the project team and be part of a world class Magento development team. WE'LL NEED YOU TO • Develop Magento solutions • Maintain Magento budget templates • Provide back end budgets for new build and enhancement requests • Approve and collaborate on development lifecycle deliverables including PSDs, Wireframes, Base Styles, Development / Code, QA Issues and resolution • Review developer code and project delivery to maintain and improve code quality control and adherence to standards • Contribute to and review back end developer standards and training plans • Guide and mentor the back end development team • Develop and maintain work plans • Assist with sales activities • Maintain and evolve development process • Participate in recruiting activities and events apply if you • Enjoy a challenge and are looking to grow • Are excited to work on high traffic, high profile websites with complex requirements • Are looking for a company that places value on training and skills development you must have • 5 years experience building solutions with Magento • Strong communication skills (both written and verbal) • Experience optimizing and refactoring application code • Optimized web server configurations and have experience scaling web applications it'd be great if you had • Experience leading teams on Magento build engagements. Magento certified. - provided by Dice

Since our formation in 2002, we have been trusted by Fortune 500 organizations to help them locate and hire best-in-class talent through our Award-winning Professional Workforce Solutions program. Check out our careers page to see all of our job openings: One of our BEST F500 customers has engaged us to help them hire a Drupal Developer (Remote) to be available to work out of their office in Chicago, Illinois; details can be found below. 2-3 months with possible extension for additional projects Please apply or call one of us to learn more One of our Direct Clients is looking for a Drupal Developer (Remote). Please submit resumes to mremya at divihn dot com or call with any questions. Responsibilities Work with other developers to build out additional features to their Flagship website which is being developed in Drupal by in-house. Also, work on additional related projects. Required skills Drupal 8, PHP, HTML, JavaScript, JavaScript libraries, jQuery, CSS Excellent communication skills to be able to communicate with other developers and stakeholders. About us: DivIHN , the 'IT Asset Performance Services' organization, provides Professional Consulting, Custom Projects, and Professional Resource Augmentation services to clients in the Mid-West and beyond. The strategic characteristics of the organization are Standardization, Specialization, and Collaboration. DivIHN is an equal opportunity employer. DivIHN does not and shall not discriminate against any employee or qualified applicant on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status. - provided by Dice

items.content:
PHP Developer

Company: WorldCoders
Location: Lisbon, PT
Remote location: Partially remote
Requires Work Permit
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
Full-stack Developer
Skills:
  • JavaScript
  • Laravel
  • PHP

    • Intro

    You will be working for the preferred partner for corporations throughout Europe when it comes to implementing and providing maintenance for its customers’ new digital technologies. More than 40,000 service calls per day clearly make our client one of Europe’s leading organization in this market and prove, that if things need fixing, they’ll provide a solution. From telecommunications and IT to security & safety installations, smart building technologies and POS devices – its more than 8,000 service engineer will find solutions for new technologies. The company offers full service human and technical support to help its customers with new technologies, relying on its network of engineers around Europe for on-site interventions (installation and maintenance) and provides logistics and call center support with its back-office teams.

    Our Team: 

    • Our team utilize an Open source framework called Laravel and we run on new technologies such as  Docker, Git, PHP >5.4, and Google Nearline. 
    • We have a friendly environment where developers work together on the same system and practices transparent communication using Slack and Redmine.

    Main requirements

    What we look for: 
     
    • We are looking for a qualified PHP developer who has a reliable Javascript working experience to join our Agile team environment practicing Scrum and someone who can analyse business requirements and convert these into features in production.
    • A team-player who can think together with the team members on how to improve application performance, share ideas on how to improve the system, implement features that will make the application user-friendly and can participate in creative brainstorming on new features.

    Qualifications: 
     
    • At least 3 years’ experience building software in PHP professionally.
    • Experience with PHP >= 5.4
    • Working knowledge on Laravel Framework.
    • Javascript, ExtJS, jQuery

    Nice to have

    • Good to have: 
      • ‘Go-getter’ attitude 
      • Github account 
      • Linux experience 
      • HTML5, CSS3 
      • Exposure to other modern PHP framework such as Symfony and Zend 

    Perks

    • A great workplace in the heart of booming Lisbon
    • Work on new features and functionality for great brands
    • Work on the quality of the code and a propriety framework
    • Great possibilities to learn and grow
    • Joining and help building our community of code fanatics
    • An excellent salary that matches your skills and experience
    • A really inspiring second home we call office with great colleagues and stuff

items.title: Engineering Manager, Machine Learning at Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=0, dotnet=0, c=10, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=14, ruby=0, apple=0, java=7, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Engineering Manager, Machine Learning

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Education Technology, eLearning, Non-Profit
Company size: 201–500 people
Company: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. | No office location

Technologies

python
php
java

Job description

Summary

The Wikimedia Foundation is growing its Machine learning efforts. This an opportunity to be part of the team that builds and maintain machine learning technologies to empower millions of users – readers, contributors, and donors – who contribute to Wikipedia and its sister projects on a daily basis. We address process inefficiencies with machine learning technologies, we design and test new technology, we produce empirical insights, and we publish and present research of the intersection of technology and culture. We are strongly committed to principles of transparency, privacy, and collaboration. We use free and open source technology and we collaborate with external researchers and our volunteer community.

We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to help build features that enable our communities to achieve our Vision: a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. As an Engineering Manager, you will support engineers building features, products, and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. This is an opportunity to do good while improving one of the best known sites in the world.

We’d like you to do these things:   

  • Partner closely with other teams and departments across the Wikimedia Foundation to define and experiment with machine learning products. These could be brand new feature offerings in Wikipedia or augmentation of existing workflows.
  • Review and advice in code changes made by team.
  • Represent team members within the organization and Wikimedia community.
  • Support and coach your team members in the development of their career paths.
  • Recruit and hire new team members.

We’d like you to have these skills:

  • Multiple years of experience in leading software engineering teams and managing complex projects.
  • Practical experience with machine learning, natural language processing or information retrieval in products that have been launched to production.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Familiarity with statistics.
  • Significant experience working with data infrastructure and distributed systems at scale.
  • Experience with both scripting and compiled languages in a Linux/Unix server environment, some of: Python, PHP, Java, Javascript, C, Scala
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • BS in Computer Science or other relevant technical field or the equivalent in related work experience.

And it would be even more awesome if you have this:

  • Previous experience working on a large, mature, open source project
  • Experience working with a geographically distributed software engineering team
  • Experience with open source software development
  • Contributing to the Wikipedia or Wikimedia project communities

Show us your stuff! If you have any existing open source software that you or teams you have lead have  developed (these could be your own software or patches to other packages), please share the URLs for the source. Links to GitHub,GitLab, BitBucket, Presi, YouTube, Medium, etc. are especially useful.

U.S. Benefits & Perks*

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

*Eligible international workers' benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

More information

WMF
Blog
Wikimedia 2030
Wikimedia Medium Term Plan
Diversity and inclusion information for Wikimedia workers, by the numbers
Wikimania 2019
Annual Report - 2017

Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits

  • Fully paid premiums for medical, dental & vision insurance premiums
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contribution
  • 7-12 weeks parental leave with 100% pay + lactation room
  • Wellness Program ($1800 annual) to promote wellness & personal growth
  • Pre-tax savings plans for Transportation & Parking
  • Flexible work schedules and remote working options
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Commitment to diversity & inclusion throughout the employee lifecycle
  • 12 days vacation, 19 days holiday, 2 days volunteer work and more!
  • Lean more at https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Work_with_us

About this job

Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Mobile Application, Web Design, Web Development

Company: sgalinski | No office location

Remote details

Technologies

php
typo3
typoscript
fluid
mysql

Job description

You are looking for a (new) activity as a web developer in the TYPO3 area? Then we at sgalinski have the right job for you!

This position enables you to directly transfer the client's wishes into the TYPO3 CMS and to implement any missing features as extensions yourself.

To accomplish these tasks, you should possess the following skills:

  • Solid knowledge in handling PHP
  • Experience in the integration of TYPO3 CMS websites and/or portals
  • Interest in learning new technologies
  • Openness towards Open Source is a must
  • Good knowledge of English in word and writing is necessary (!)
  • You are not a loner and like to work in a team
  • Appreciation of quality (!)
  • Independent approach to work in an agile company

Perhaps you already have some experience with the Shopware eCommerce system. However, this is not a mandatory requirement!

Since sgalinski is organized fully remote, our employees enjoy a good work-life balance and great family friendliness.

Overview: Jobs and Benefits

Diese Stellenausschreibung auf Deutsch ansehen

Apply now

About sgalinski

We are a web agency from Munich, Germany, focused especially on TYPO3. We also offer other services and products like shops, mobile apps and special software development.

We are a well-rehearsed team, which completes digital projects with a high quality standard thanks to our agile way of working and our lively customer contact. We work remotely, are spread over several European countries and like to use English as our internal language. This gives you the opportunity to work in an up-and-coming, multinational company and make a significant impact.

Benefits

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • Home Office
  • We do not use Windows in our company! MacOS & Linux are preferred.
  • Performance-oriented pay with a solid base salary
  • Optional company pension scheme
  • Flat hierarchy
  • Have a say
  • Opportunity to get involved with Open Source projects
  • Family friendly
  • Full-time or part-time - depending on what fits best

items.content:
The Role

A tenacious, passionate and talented Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is required to join a well established, expanding and innovative Software House in the idyllic setting of Pembrokeshire. As the Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you will join a multi skilled Web Applications Team and be involved in maintaining, extending and improving website framework, designed for re-use across multiple stores and sales channels. As well as this, you will be building brand new web applications from the ground up. This role has the potential to be within a leadership capacity, dependent on your experience and you will be provided with lots of opportunity to grow.

As the Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you'll collaborate with colleagues, clients and other vendors to work out the best solutions to the ever-changing needs of a growing client base whilst working to keep them at the cutting edge of technology. Within your role as Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript).

Are you an Object Orientated Developer that posses transferable, good developer skills?

Are you the person that will be continually 'playing with' things, to ensure that you are using the best one for the task at hand? You will have the opportunity to expand your knowledge and experience in new and exciting technologies that you are interested in through lots of R&D time - specifically in the following technologies: NodeJS, React or Vue.


Role Essentials


  • Experience using OOP.
  • Experience working with PHP Frameworks, eg. Laravel, Symfony, Zend
  • You have a deep understanding of object oriented programming and design patterns
  • You know HTML inside out and have worked with some HTML APIs
  • Experience working with Cloud Tchnologies including AWS
  • You're comfortable with CSS and have experience with pre-processors eg. SASS
  • Commercial experience working on large scale projects where you have shown good decision making

Role Desirables

  • eCommerce and Payment Gateways
  • NodeJS experience
  • Javascript Frameworks, eg. AngularJS, React
  • Automated testing
  • Caching systems, eg. Memcached, Redis
  • Degree in Computer Science - recent graduates welcome

The Company

An award-winning, successful and friendly place to work, where you are given a good degree of autonomy to design and develop solutions. Teams collaborate and share ideas freely, and hierarchy and bureaucracy is kept to a minimum. In addition to the technical stuff, you'll collaborate with your peers, clients, and other vendors to work out solutions, find the quick wins, and diagnose problems.

As well as a generous salary offering you will receive benefits such as flexible working hours, remote working options, unlimited tea and coffee, onsite canteen, free lunch every Friday, state of the art hardware and the opportunity to take part in regular hackathons, plus much more!


Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) - PEMBROKE - + Additional benefits package including flexible working hours, Remote working, progression scheme, Healthcare, Annual Hackathons

Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Pembrokeshire
Permanent
£25,000 - £45,000 a year

items.content:
WordPress Engineer at Mediavine

Remote

Location: Remote · Portland, Oregon

Mediavine, a fast-growing advertising management company representing over 5,100 websites in the food, travel, lifestyle and entertainment space, is searching for a WordPress Engineer.

We currently have a growing list of WordPress products and an extensive roadmap that brings modern web solutions to WordPress users.

We are looking for an engineer who cares deeply about the quality of the products we are building, and a creative problem-solver who both understands WordPress limitations and how to optimally work within or around them.

The ideal candidate has a working knowledge of the full WordPress stack as it stands today. Any candidate must be prepared to learn new technologies and have the flexibility to adapt to non-traditional WordPress implementations.

Mediavine is a completely remote company, so communication skills are crucially important. Prior experience with remote work is also greatly desired.

Responsibilities

As an engineer at Mediavine you can expect to:

  • Build and extend our WordPress Plugins:
    • Create by Mediavine
    • Mediavine Control Panel
    • More coming soon!
  • Extend our WordPress Theme Framework
  • Develop and Extend Child Themes
  • Work with our design team to optimize user experience
  • Implement strategies to automate and optimize development
  • Manage plugin rollouts to our community of publishers
  • Ensure all plugins have met QA requirements

Requirements

A candidate must have:

  • 2-4 years professional experience
  • Ownership of/contributions to at least one published plugin with 100+ active installs
  • Experience working with Subversion and/or Git
  • Continuous drive to learn
  • Deep familiarity with WordPress core
  • 1+ Years in customer-facing role (customer service, support, etc)
  • Located within the United States

Bonus points for experience:

  • Working/familiarity with Agile Frameworks like SCRUM
  • Working with React/Preact
  • Building against Lighthouse
  • Writing/working with Object Oriented PHP
  • Using TDD, including WordPress testing frameworks

Benefits

  • Travel opportunities
  • Remote work environment
  • Comprehensive benefits including 401k, Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • Learning allowance
  • Access to experienced engineers with direct mentorship opportunities
  • Generous Vacation/Time off policies
  • Additional side benefits such as home-office upgrades, tuition reimbursement, paid gym memberships and wellness retreats, upgraded flights, cool swag and more
  • Salary: $65,000 – $85,000
Apply for job

PHP / MySQL / Linux

SW Engineering / R&D

Cambridge or Remote

Salary dependent on experience

The role

To build greenfield logistics software using PHP, MySQL and Linux. They look for problems solvers, people who can get involved with architecting, developing, tool and tech selection on the full stack. There are several teams / disciplines from SW Engineering, R&D and Data Science.

The Person

You will be a problem solver above all else, open to using new technologies and have an R&D mind-set. Strong academics help. You will want to partake in architecture, developemtn and tool selection.

PHP, MySQL, Linux, related PHP frameworks

The team

The brightest in the industry, as location is not barrier as the work is remote they have managed to get the best developers in the UK onto this team and it's a place to contribute as well as learn. There is about 45 in the team which is usually split into smaller silo team.

Project

Large logistics / warehouse solutions

Location

Remote, 1 day fortnightly in the Cambridge Office.

About Songspace, INC

Songspace is a growing music technology company based in Nashville that designs, builds, and delivers innovative products and services for music creators, publishers, and labels to manage music catalogs, collaborate with other creators and rights owners, send and share songs and playlists, and organize the creative workflows in music rights management. The foundation of the company mission and culture is a shared passion for music, music creators, music rights, and technology.  We work closely with creators and rights holders to ensure our products and services provide a superior experience and value. We continually strive to earn the trust of the thousands of publishers, labels, and creators around the world that rely on our products to manage, promote, and deliver their music copyrights and recordings.

Benefits

  • Vacation and paid time off
  • Attention to personal development
  • Regular team events/excursions
  • Healthy and friendly work environment
  • Flexible hours
  • Work From Home
  • Health Insurance

items.title: WP WhiteSecurity: Senior PHP / WordPress Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=83, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior PHP / WordPress Developer

 
WP White Security is a young remote software company, originally founded in Edinburgh, United Kingdom. We develop a number high-quality WordPress security and admin plugins. Our plugins are installed on more than 100,000 websites and used by world renowned businesses such as Disney, Amazon and Intel!



Join our growing distributed team and develop great plugins that help thousands of WordPress websites administrators! We are looking for a senior back-end PHP / WordPress / JavaScirpt developer that can work during European time zone hours. If you love writing code, and are fond of the WordPress and open source communities, we want to hear from you

We are still a small team, however, we have a large customer base. So naturally, there is a lot of room to grow within the company. 



What will your job be?

You will be leading the development of our WordPress plugins portfolio. Your tasks will span from writing code, bug fixing and implementing new features, expecting that new and changed code is thoroughly tested and well documented.

You will also interact with other team members to help troubleshoot and resolve customer issues, and also interact with the rest of the team for knowledge sharing and product work.



Who are we looking for?

  • Excellent verbal and written English
  • 5+ years experience working as a PHP / WordPress plugin developer
  • Strong background in scalable database usage with MySQL
  • Good understanding of Linux, Apache, MySQL and PHP (LAMP) environments
  • Hard working and passionate – we are a young start-up
  • [BONUS] good understanding of application and WordPress security

Benefits of working for us

  • Work from anywhere as long as you have your computer and internet connection (remote job)
  • Work in a flat, small and young organization
  • Paid travel to attend WordCamps and other industry conferences
  • Long term engagement – we are looking for a committed candidate who within a few years can become a team lead and a source of knowledge

How to apply

Send us your CV to careers@wpwhitesecurity.com. If you have a Github, BitBucket or other repository with example of code you have written, please include them in the email so we can take a look at them. In the email also include the answers to the following questions:
  • What are your payment expectations?
  • What are you looking for in your next job?

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=6, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=29, embedded=0, frontend=30}
items.content:
About Tutorful Founded in 2015, Tutorful is a tech start-up situated in the heart of Sheffield. Our vision and mission is to make tutoring affordable and accessible to all. We now have over 10,000 tutors across the UK delivering over 10,000 lessons per week, both in person and online. Our revolutionary approach to tutoring and our fantastic growth have helped us become recognised as one of the top 100 startups in the UK. We’re building a stellar team to help us achieve our goal. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work - our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t, and make a genuine impact on the lives of thousands of young learners. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure.


The role


We are looking for a full stack developer who can help define and build the customer-facing side of our business. The role will include: Joining a small, autonomous, agile team using modern web development methodologies such as continuous delivery. Working with your team to come up with ideas and define the backlog, with the aim of solving real customer problems. Bringing new features to life, from initial design through to writing well structured modular code, automated tests, and deployment. Working closely with other teams around the office, including product managers, marketing and customer support. What we’re looking for We don’t have an ideal candidate, and aptitude and a willingness to learn are just as important than qualifications or experience.


 


With that said, having familiarity with some of the technologies and methodologies below would be beneficial:


Prior experience and success building products as a full stack developer.


Knowledge of PHP 7, and a modern framework such as Laravel or Symfony.


Experience building and using scalable APIs. Familiarity with modern devops, including deployment pipelines.


Fluency with at least one major Javascript framework (ideally Vue, but experience in React or Angular would also be applicable).


An understanding of scalable frontend architecture. Familiarity with modern tooling such as Grunt/Gulp, Webpack, Docker, Git etc.


 


If you have skills that align with this role and you could contribute to our goals but your experience or salary expectations don't match what we're offering, don't be put off. We look for the right people and we are flexible, so we'd still encourage applications from strong candidates.


 


Benefits: Some of our benefits include: 25 days holiday, with an extra day for each year you are with us (up to 28).


An additional 5 days holiday through salary sacrifice.


Genuinely flexible working, with remote working on Wednesdays.


A great office environment, including free fruit, beer on Thursday afternoons, and regular company-organised socials.


Regular conference opportunities and a dedicated training budget.


A generous equity scheme for senior employees.


Please send CV’s if you feel you would be a good fit for this role. We look forward to hearing from you.

items.content:
IWT

Senior IT Lead


US-only
**Are you maniacal about clean code? Does scalable architecture make your heart sing? Do you want to solve complex problems with crazy smart people in a 100% remote environment? The team at IWT would love to talk to you.** **About the role** As the Senior IT Lead you'll be responsible for all day to day IT operations. We have no in house development so you'll wear a lot of hats including: * Sourcing and managing external IT vendor partners * Partnering with other teams and vendors to lead issue resolution and post mortems * Planning the IT release roadmap and calendar * Managing the IT Backlog * Defining and communicating technical requirements * Validating the work of external vendors and approving delivery of code * Defining the process and policies required to manage multiple IT platforms, internal and external stakeholders, and providing outstanding delivery to a user base of over 500,000 users. In this role you'll report directly to the Director of Operations. You'll manage your own budget and your own department. If you are an architect or developer with exceptional organizational skills and want to take a jump into a more strategic role, you're exactly who we're looking for. If you've ever wanted a chance to make your mark and run your own show, this is a great opportunity for you. **Requirements** * 3+ years building highly dynamic and scalable web applications using PHP, WordPress and WordPress plug-ins in a fast cycle development environment. * 2+ years experience with AWS * Extensive experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and MySQL * Experience in CakePHP and Ruby on Rails * Extensive experience with integrating multiple systems (API, etc) * Hands on experience in Release Management and DevOps * Exceptional written and verbal communications * Strong architectural comprehension * Deep commitment to quality, scalable code and agile delivery * Ability to work unsupervised and take ownership * Hyper organized * Great sense of humor * Able to work remotely with your own phone, computer and high speed internet access in place. * This is a full-time, 100% remote position. Must be US based. **Nice to Have** * Prior experience in the infoproducts industry or with ecommerce * BS in Computer Science or other technical field * Experience with Salesforce or Marketo * Prior experience leading virtual teams * Prior experience in Vendor Management and Sourcing * Past leadership experience * Prior experience in Project Management or Technical Analysis **About us** For the past 13 years, we’ve quietly built a private company that has become one of the leaders in online education and self development. Over 1 million Top Performers read us every month for advice on money, entrepreneurship, careers, relationships, and personal productivity. We build no-BS personal-development brands that deliver real results. We tell the truth about how the world works -- even when it’s uncomfortable to hear. We value trust over short-term sales. We’re selective and demanding about who we serve. We’re a high performance team of exceptionally talented and diverse individuals, and we nurture each other’s personalities, creativity and obsessions to bring forth unique content, products and services to the market. Our goal is to help millions of people live richer, more fulfilling lives. And it takes an entire team committed to something bigger than themselves to make that kind of impact. We are seeking high caliber individuals who want to help push us to the next level. If you like to move quickly and have a bias for action, you’ll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We’re a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are. We’re excited to work alongside the best in the world to make a difference in millions of people’s lives. #Location - US-only

Job description

At roobeo.com, we have a vision of a unique supply solution for the construction industry. To help us conquer the market we are looking for talented individuals to work with us to turn our concept into reality. If you are interested in joining our young start-up and working with creative and motivated colleagues towards achieving our vision, then we look forward to receiving your application!

Your profile:

About this job

Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer

Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Publicare Marketing Communications GmbH | Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin
Office Location: Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

php
javascript
sql
rest

Job description

Chance für Entwickler, die sich entfalten wollen!
Du bist ein PHP-/Javascript-Entwickler, der sich gerne in den aktuellsten Frameworks bewegt, für den Entwicklung und Programmierung eine Berufung ist und der dabei noch über den Tellerrand hinausblickt. Bei uns erwarten Dich spannende Aufgaben und die Chance, durch clevere Lösungen und Qualität zu punkten – in Frankfurt am Main oder in Deinem Home-Office.

PHP-/Javascript-Entwickler mit einem Faible für Datenprozesse (w/m/d)
Bei uns findest Du viele sympathische Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die genauso denken wie Du. Einen Arbeitsplatz, der hervorragend ausgestattet ist und der in unserem Office in Frankfurt am Main oder gerne auch in Deinem Home-Office sein kann. Du willst weniger als 40 Stunden die Woche arbeiten? Mit unserer flexiblen Teilzeitgestaltung hast Du Arbeitszeiten, die sich an Deinen Lebensrhythmus anpassen. Lass uns einfach darüber reden, wie wir zusammenkommen!

Das tust Du!
Gemeinsam mit den Kollegen aus der Entwicklung beantwortest Du Kundenanforderungen, denkst Dich in den Workflow und die Prozesse unserer Kunden ein und unterstützt diese durch geeignete Applikationen – ohne lange Entscheidungsprozesse innerhalb der Organisation.

Die Entwicklung komplexer B2B-Anwendungen gehören zu Deinem Alltag, genauso wie Web-Formulare, Landing-Pages oder Microsites. Über die Entwicklung, das Testing bis zur Implementierung stellst Du sicher, dass Deine Projekte termin- und qualitätsgerecht live gehen – maßgeschneidert, userfreundlich und optimal auf den jeweiligen technischen Background abgestimmt.

Klar, dass Du die Schnittstellen zu den Kernsystemen unserer Kunden zuverlässig mitbedenkst und auf User Experience, Responsive Design und Site Speed achtest.

Du bist stets über neue Entwicklungen und Trends bei Web-Technologien informiert und weißt, diese sinnvoll und effizient in Projekten nutzbar zu machen.

Das bist Du!
Du verfügst über Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Web-Applikationen auf Basis von modernen Frameworks wie Laravel und der Kenntnis gängiger Entwurfsmuster.

  • Mit den Frontend-Markup-Standards (HTML5, CSS3) sowie PHP 7 und SQL bist Du vertraut.
  • Unittest, PHPUnit & Codeception – Du denkst nur TDD, BDD & DDD.
  • REST, SOAP, ECMAScript & Vue.js – geht Dir leicht von der Hand.
  • Ein gutes Gespür für nutzerfreundliches Interface-Design hast Du auch.
  • Du beherrschst Englisch sicher in Wort und Schrift.
  • Dazu bist Du ein aufgeschlossener, kommunikativer Teamplayer.
Apply now

About Publicare Marketing Communications GmbH

Das sind wir
Es gibt Online-Marketing-Agenturen, die wickeln für Ihre Kunden Projekte ab. Und es gibt Publicare: seit 1994. Wir beraten ganzheitlich und zeigen neue Wege auf – strategisch, technisch und kreativ.

Am Ende steht immer eine passgenaue Plattform für unsere Kunden bereit, die wir aus einem großen Repertoire aus Bausteinen zusammensetzen. Je nach Zielsetzung entwickeln wir weitere Elemente oder integrieren große Cloud-Anwendungen bzw. die Systeme unserer Kunden. Namenhafte nationale und internationale Unternehmen wie eBay, Vodafone, mobile.de, Unitymedia, LIDL, toom, Alnatura und viele mehr vertrauen auf unsere Lösungen. Und künftig auch auf Dich! Denn Du wirst bei uns anspruchsvolle Web- und Portalprojekte realisieren und testen!

Das bieten wir Dir

  • Du bestimmst die Arbeitszeit – ob  dreiviertel oder ganztags – wir sind so flexibel wie Du.
  • Ein Top-ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz in Frankfurt-Sachsenhausen oder in Deinem Home-Office.
  • Spannende Web-Projekte und die Chance, durch Deinen Input, clevere Lösungen und Qualität zu punkten.
  • Strukturiertes, eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten ohne lange Entscheidungsprozesse mit Freiraum für die berufliche Weiterentwicklung.
  • Guter Kaffee, frisches Obst, Kekse, ÖPNV-Ticket uvm.

Interessiert?
Rufe Robert Harnischmacher unter der 069 – 60 50 09 56 an, um darüber zu reden, wie wir zusammenkommen!

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung an:
Publicare Marketing Communications GmbH
Städelstraße 10
60596 Frankfurt am Main
jobs[at]publicare.de

Senior Magento Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Agile Software Development, Enterprise Web Solutions, Technology Consulting

Company type: Private
Company: Curotec | No office location

Technologies

php
magento2
magento

Job description

We are looking for a highly skilled developer that has experience in building complex E-commerce websites using the Magento 2 framework. The position is for a full-time contract with the option to convert to a full-time employee at the end. Candidates should have experience dealing with standard and custom extension development, security, payment integration, ERP and MA integration as well as custom pricing and multilingual sites.

We are expecting this position to be a remote one, however, our office is based in Wayne, PA USA.



Job Requirements

- Must be able to work EDT business hours. 8am - 5pm New York time.

- Must be able to speak and write fluent English. Your first interview will be a video call via Skype.

 - Must be dedicated, passionate and hard-working. Attitude is everything.

- Must be able to work with a team and collaborate remotely. Hard workers and self-starters please apply.

Technical Requirements:

- Must have experience with PHP, Magento, Javascript, HTML5, CSS3.

- Must have experience with system integrations and custom extension development.

- Experience with M1 to M2 migrations a plus

- Theme customization, frontend experience

- Experience in Payment/Shipping method development
- Experience in Custom extension development / Core feature customization

- Able to work with Adobe PSD files

- Magento Certifications a plus



Please list your skills and experience with each framework you know as well as your ability to work with others and meet deadlines. We are looking for more than just, “I can do xyz tasks”. We are looking for a thoughtful response as to why you are a good candidate for this job.

Our Hiring Process

We have a 2-part hiring process that includes a written code test and then a video interview.

  • Code Test
    In order to qualify for the position, you must pass a code test that takes 2 - 4 hours to complete.
  • Video Interview
    Verbal technical interview and then personal interview.
Apply now

About Curotec

We have a really interesting team of people that span many different skill sets, cultures and backgrounds. We are a melting pot of sorts. One of the things our team members enjoy the most about working at Curotec is their ability to learn new things every day, not only about technology but also about their fellow team members and their cultures.

Testimonials from our team:

"I really like the work culture and ethics followed at Curotec. They give you the required ownership and freedom to complete the work. Management is really cooperative and friendly. Curotec is a highly recommended workplace for anyone!"

"Real job but working from home or any place gives freedom and peace. Working with Professional teams and good projects gives head start to mid-level developers."

“I am very grateful for the opportunity Curotec has given me to discover my hidden skills and gain experience in the industry. I am happy to work on the team in a growing company environment."

Our Process:

At Curotec, we are not your typical web development company. Our focus leans heavily on user experience and also maintaining a cutting-edge approach to our design and development for enterprise-level solutions.

Our process follows an agile development approach and closely involves our clients in the key iterations of their website or product. We understand the importance of mobile development and cross-device support so your end users can access your information easily.

Benefits

  • Paid time off
  • Work from home
  • Access to training resources
  • Multicultural team experience

items.content:
Drupal / Magento Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Company: Bear Group | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time

Technologies

php
javascript
git
jira
html

Job description

Bear Group is a leading web development firm based in Seattle looking for an experienced backend web developer to join our team of Drupal and Magento. We're looking for an amazing developer who is well versed in either the Magento or Drupal platform (both would be amazing). You will have the opportunity to work with leading companies and marketing teams to develop complex sites and integrations between systems.

We are a fully distributed team that primarily builds in PHP on the Magento and Drupal platforms for ecommerce and content management sites. Since we are fully remote, you can work from anywhere! We do require at least 4 hours of working time overlap with the Pacific time zone work day where most of our clients are located. As a highly client focused organization, you will occasionally need to meet according to their schedule. This typically falls between 10 and 5 Pacific time, and we strive to give you plenty of time to focus on development.

Working with a variety of clients, we fluidly form groups including a Technical Project Manager, a Quality Analyst, and one or more developers to complete sprints of work. The type of work depends on the client, but often includes:

  • Developing custom modules and extensions for Drupal CMS and Magento Commerce.
  • Integration with various APIs and third-party systems.
  • Migrating existing sites to modern platforms.
  • Knowledgeable with front-end development: HTML/CSS/Javascript coding, with Twig and PHP at the template level

With Bear Group, you will tackle technical problems, code and debug primarily PHP/javascript/css, and occasionally participate in client meetings. You will need to be self-motivating and able to work independently most of the time, but we have a friendly and capable team to collaborate with when you encounter obstacles. Since the technology world is constantly evolving, you’ll be expected to keep up with the current technologies and practices. To help with this, we provide an annual education stipend that can be used for attending relevant conferences or continued education courses.

During your first week you will work closely with one of our senior developers to set up your new system and familiarize with our processes and tools. The system will be either Mac, Linux, or Windows to your preference, and we use Vagrant to manage virtual machines for a consistent development server stack. Other tools you will use include:

  • Git for source control
  • Bitbucket for Git repositories
  • Jira for project management
  • Confluence for documentation
  • Slack for communication.

As you get your feet under you we will introduce some project work, again in collaboration with a senior developer on a sprint they are currently working on. Ultimately our developers work independently on your own tickets and sprints.

In addition to competitive pay, a new computer, insurance, and 401k match, you’ll also receive:

  • 3 Weeks PTO plus approximately 10 vacation days annually
  • $1500 annual education stipend
  • Software stipend for the tools that you prefer to do the job


To learn more about the company, visit www.beargroup.com. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Die Position versetzt dich in die Lage direkt die Wünsche des Kunden im TYPO3 CMS zu überführen und gegebenenfalls fehlende Features als Erweiterung selbst zu implementieren.

Um diese Aufgabe bewältigen zu können, solltest du folgende Eigenschaften mitbringen:

  • Solide Kenntnisse im Umgang mit PHP
  • Erfahrung in der Integration von TYPO3 CMS-Websites und/oder -Portalen

  • Offenheit gegenüber OpenSource ist ein Muss

Eventuell hast du auch schon Erfahrung mit dem Shopware eCommerce-System gesammelt. Dies ist jedoch keine zwingende Voraussetzung!

Da sgalinski vollständig remote organisiert ist, genießen unsere Mitarbeiter eine gute Work-Life-Balance und große Familienfreundlichkeit.

About sgalinski

Wir sind eine Webagentur aus München, die sich speziell auf TYPO3 fokussiert hat. Ebenso bieten wir aber auch andere Leistungen und Produkte an wie Shops, Mobile Apps und spezielle Software-Entwicklung.

Wir sind ein eingespieltes Team, welches dank agiler Arbeitsweise und regem Kundenkontakt digitale Projekte mit hohem Qualitätsstandard abschließt. Grundsätzlich arbeiten wir remote, sind auf mehrere europäische Länder verteilt und verwenden gerne Englisch als interne Sprache. Somit hast du die Möglichkeit in einem aufstrebenden, multinationalen Unternehmen zu arbeiten und dich zu profilieren.

items.title: React/JS Dev (f/m/d) Remote/Homeoffice - WordPress Projects @ Enterprise Level at Inpsyde GmbH
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=21, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=194, embedded=0, frontend=79}
items.content:
React/JS Dev (f/m/d) – Remote/Homeoffice - WordPress Projects @ Enterprise Level

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer, Full Stack Developer
Company: Inpsyde GmbH | No office location

Technologies

wordpress
php
woocommerce
javascript
reactjs

Job description

Please be aware, if you do not live in Europe currently or don't have an European Citizenship, we can't consider your application!

You are an experienced or talented web developer we can count on, know your way around object-oriented PHP programming and, you want to realize sophisticated WordPress projects with the highest code quality in the B2B area together with other top WordPress developers?

Work on exciting projects:

  • We are the only agency worldwide which is WordPress VIP Gold Agency Partner and WooExpert
  • We develop tailor-made, high-scale and high-traffic projects for our international enterprise clients
  • We audit plugins, interfaces and themes for our customers, service providers and the community

What we can offer

  • Work in your home office (we are 100% remote)
  • A warm Inpsyde culture that values YOU
  • Flexible working hours
  • A team of very experienced, highly qualified WordPress experts and top Stack Exchange users
  • As “WordPress.com VIP Partner”: A direct line to WooCommerce and WP Core developers
  • Work very close to the pulse of the latest WordPress development and technologies
  • Demanding and extraordinary projects in the B2B sector
  • Small teams in an agile environment
  • International teams, colleagues and clients
  • Interesting projects with clients like SAP, Facebook, P&G, PayPal and other Fortune 500 companies
  • Open mindset with weekly exchange of knowledge and talks by colleagues via video conference
  • Great team spirit with colleagues you like to work with
  • Travels and talks on WordCamps and WooConfs
  • Openness to entrepreneurial thinking and action
  • Flat hierarchies and short decision-making paths
  • 20 days of annual paid vacation and 10 sick days

Main Tasks

  • Together with our top WordPress developers, you will implement modern and advanced WordPress projects with state-of-the-art code quality in the B2B area
  • Support and maintenance of websites of long-standing customers
  • Test solutions across multiple browsers and platforms in a local testing environment
  • Deploy changes to live servers
  • Assist in the remediation, enhancement, and maintenance of client sites
  • Develop reusable and maintainable web and theme components
  • Code and review PHP, Webpack, Encore, SASS, React, NodeJS/Deno applications using version control
  • Planning and issue-management via JIRA, Confluence and Slack
  • Deployment via Envoyer and dependency-management via Composer

Your Profile

  • You do live in Europe or have European Citizenship (required)
  • Intermediate or expert skills in: WordPress, JavaScript, React, PHP
  • You are passionate about web development and new technology (elegant code)
  • You know your way around object-oriented PHP programming
  • Analytical skills as well as creative and solution-oriented thinking and working
  • Experience with
    • using Git
    • working with modern dependency managers & task runners
    • REST API / SOAP
    • modern JavaScript/Frontend development and frameworks
  • Flexibility and an independent and structured way of working
  • Team-oriented behaviour and very good communication skills
  • Solve client challenges with understanding and empathy
  • You share your knowledge with your teammates
  • Solve complex problems in a simple and elegant way
  • You are eager to learn new things
  • Ability to setup local environments
  • Ability to communicate professionally with technical and non-technical colleagues and clients
  • Proficiency in verbal and written English

Optional

  • Verbal and written German skills
  • Experience with JIRA & Confluence
  • Experience with WooCommerce, Multisite, custom API integrations
  • Experience working for demanding or enterprise-level clients
  • Knowledge of relational database and non-relational database
  • Knowledge in automated testing
  • You like to work agile
  • Remote working experience appreciated

Date of joining: As soon as possible! But we wait for good developers, of course.

Sounds interesting to you? Apply now as React / JS Developer (f/m/d) ! 

Many exciting possibilities are waiting for you! We are looking forward to have you as an Inpsyder!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please send us your CV, your salary expectations and your earliest possible starting date.

Otherwise we cannot consider your application!

And again the information: Please be aware, if you do not live in Europe currently or don't have a European Citizenship, we won't consider your application!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Apply now

About Inpsyde GmbH

Inpsyde: The biggest WordPress agency in Germany

As an official “WordPress.com VIP Gold Partner” of Automattic (the company behind WordPress) and WooCommerce Gold Expert, we are leaders in demanding WordPress projects. We are the founders of the community platform WordPress Germany and have already distributed, co-designed, translated and extended WordPress in the early years. Therefore, the community, WordCamps, and core development have been an important part of our values for over 10 years.

We mainly realize large marketing sites and WooCommerce projects for medium-sized companies and international corporations.

Working at Inpsyde

Work with our great team of WordPress experts and top users on WordPress Stack Exchange. Exchange ideas, learn from them or let yourself be tempted to perform at your best as part of a team.

In contrast to ordinary employers, you will work remotely on new challenges in the WordPress world where you want – near your coffee machine, in the park or at your favourite place. This also means that you can flexibly organize your working hours.

You communicate with your colleagues via slack, hangout and zoom, while you create your own working environment with your hardware and your favourite coffee, among other things.

Or meet colleagues at WordCamps, Meetups or WooConfs worldwide to exchange ideas with other developers or to give talks on behalf of the company.

Develop WordPress plugins or websites for international companies like Facebook, SAP, Mercedes, Parship or WooCommerce extensions for e-commerce big names like PayPal. But also for medium-sized companies that do not need off-the-shelf websites or plugins.

You will also be involved in the collaboration on plugins that we make available on wordpress.org, such as BackWPup with over 7 million downloads and over 600,000 active users or MultilingualPress as the professional solution for multilingualism for WordPress and WooCommerce websites.

In small teams, a project manager and a direct line to the CEO, you can make a valuable contribution with your ideas.

Apply now! Many exciting possibilities are waiting for you!

Become an Inpsyder!

Job description

Ihre Aufgaben

Als Teil des IT-Teams gestalten Sie an den wesentlichen Arbeitsabläufen  eines Weiterbildungsunternehmens aktiv mit. Sie unterstützen uns bei der Pflege, dem Ausbau und der Optimierung unserer IT-Lösungen.

Sie haben Kenntnisse im Bereich der PHP-Entwicklung? Dann versuchen Sie sich doch an unserem kleinen Puzzle und zeigen, was Sie können!

expertcloud.wbstraining.de/index.php/s/kDb2OVsF9xmi8ny/authenticate

Das Passwort zu dem Link lautet: tr8srq

Die Lösung senden Sie bitte an hackathon@wbstraining.de.

Falls Sie das Puzzle nicht lösen können, ist das kein Problem, viel wichtiger ist für uns die Herangehensweise an unsere Aufgabe.

Wir wünschen Ihnen viel Spaß und freuen uns auf Ihre Lösungen.

Ihre Stärken

Sie teilen unsere Begeisterung, Menschen bei der Erweiterung ihrer  beruflichen Kompetenzen und Integration in den Arbeitsmarkt zu unterstützen und bringen darüber hinaus ein hohes Maß an Einsatz- und Lernbereitschaft sowie Freude am Arbeiten im Team mit.

  • Studium oder Ausbildung der Informatik bzw. eines verwandten Bereichs
  • Oder gleichwertige Kenntnisse, die im Bereich der privaten Programmierung erworben wurden. Auch Quereinsteiger sind bei uns herzlich willkommen und können sich gern ausprobieren.
  • Erfahrung mit PHP- bzw. Symfony-Programmierung

Sie lieben neue Herausforderungen und möchten die Zukunft der digitalen Bildung mitgestalten? Dann sind Sie bei uns genau richtig !

Wir wollen Ihre Neugier auf unsere vielfältigen Aufgaben wecken und Sie als motivierten Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) gewinnen.

Als modernes Unternehmen bieten wir Ihnen die Möglichkeit, die Stelle zu 100% aus dem Home-Office auszuüben.

Apply now

About WBS Gruppe

Die WBS GRUPPE gehört zu den führenden privaten Bildungsanbietern in Deutschland. Das Bildungsangebot umfasst geförderte berufliche Weiterbildungen und Umschulungen (WBS TRAINING), berufsbegleitende Bildungsangebote (WBS AKADEMIE) sowie Ausbildungen in den Bereichen Gesundheit, Pflege und Soziales (WBS SCHULEN). Mit digitalen und flexiblen Lernformaten werden exzellente Qualifikationen, Selbstkompetenzen und praktisches Fachwissen vermittelt. Damit steigern wir gezielt die Job- und Karrierechancen unserer Kunden und helfen Unternehmen, kompetente Fachkräfte zu finden und zu fördern.

Gemeinwohl macht Sinn. Wachstum und Werte prägen unser Denken und Handeln.

Zitat "Die WBS GRUPPE steht für nachhaltiges und ethisches Wirtschaften. Im Mittelpunkt
steht nicht nur der Gewinn, sondern ebenso Nachhaltigkeit und Teilhabe. Konkrete Beispiele sind unser Beschaffungsmanagement, die WBS Spendenaktion oder agile Führung.“

Heinrich Kronbichler,
Vorstand der WBS TRAINING AG

Benefits

  • Gestalten - Flache Hierarchien und agile Strukturen
  • Lernen - Zahlreiche Weiterbildungen warten auf Dich!
  • Work-Life-Balance - Teilzeit, Sabbatical, flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • Sinn - wir orientieren uns an der Idee des Gemeinwohls.
  • Wohlfühlen - freundliches Miteinander, gesunde Ernährung: Feel good!
  • Freiraum - Homeoffice, innovatives Arbeitsumfeld - viel Raum für Ideen
  • Entwicklung - viele, spannende Weiterbildungen warten auf Dich!

Job description

This position is for US residents only.

Accella is looking for a developer with experience building websites and modules in Drupal. The candidate will need to show an expertise in Drupal development that goes deeper than basic theming and should have experience building custom modules and integrating with third party applications and services.

In addition to Drupal experience, we are looking for a candidate with a mixed skillset, including experience with React, React Native, or other JavaScript libraries. While the position will be Drupal focused, it is likely the candidate will be asked to work on projects ranging from web to mobile, so we are looking for a more well-rounded individual in terms of a technology background.

We will heavily weigh the applicants problem solving skills. Must be highly motivated and a serious self starter.

Must have the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical resources. We are looking for someone that enjoys being part of a team and will offer feedback and ideas in order to design and develop the most solid and extensible products for our clients.

We want a leader, an ideas person, and someone that is eager to work on multiple challenging projects, sometimes simultaneously.

What we expect in a candidate: 

- BS in Computer Science, BS in closely related discipline or equivalent industry experience

- Candidate must be located within the US, but can be located anywhere around the country

- 3+ years experience with Drupal development including experience with Drupal 8

- At least 5 years experience with software development

- At least 1 year experience with React or other JavaScript technologies

- Effective communication skills (written and oral)

- Problem-solving and creative mindset

- Experience thriving in a high-performance, results-oriented organization

- Experience and proficiency in interacting with external clients

- Experience with Ruby on Rails a plus

- Experience with native mobile development a plus

Apply now

About Accella

What we offer you:

- Unlimited opportunity for growth
- Competitive salary
- Health Insurance
- Full Time Telecommute (though occasional client meetings may be required)

Accella is a web, mobile, and desktop software development company with headquarters located in Severna Park, MD that was recently nominated as one of the best places to work in Baltimore. With a wide array of clients across multiple industries, our development opportunities are vast and always interesting.

You are an experienced or talented web developer we can count on, know your way around object-oriented PHP programming and, together with other top WordPress developers, you want to realize sophisticated WordPress projects with the highest code quality in the B2B area?

Then you can certainly imagine to work among others on the following exciting projects:

  • Working on a multilingual WooCommerce shop with connection to external services such as SAP Business One
  • Further development and support of known plugins (eg. BackWPup or MultilingualPress)
  • Developing tailor-made high-performance and secure plugins, interfaces and themes for our customers, service providers and the community

What we can offer

  • Work in your home office (we are 100% remote)
  • A warm Inpsyde culture that values YOU
  • Flexible working hours
  • Very experienced, highly qualified WordPress experts and top Stack Exchange users as colleagues
  • As a “WordPress.com VIP Partner” we have a direct line to WooCommerce and WP Core Developer
  • Very close to the pulse of the latest WordPress development and technologies
  • Demanding and extraordinary projects in the B2B sector
  • Small team in an agile environment
  • Weekly exchange of knowledge and talks by colleagues in a video conference
  • Great team spirit with colleagues you like to work with
  • Travels and discussions on WordCamps and WooConf
  • Flat hierarchies and short decision-making paths
  • 20 days of annual paid vacation and 10 sick days
  • International teams, colleagues and clients
  • Interesting projects with clients like SAP, Facebook, P&G, PayPal and other companies known all over the world
  • Openness to entrepreneurial thinking and action

Main Tasks

  • Together with our top WordPress developers, you will implement modern and advanced WordPress projects with state-of-the-art code quality in the B2B area
  • Development of new plugins with high code quality and future-proof implementation
  • Solve bugs and address client issues in a fast-paced environment
  • Work on current projects with incoming tasks
  • Test solutions across multiple browsers and platforms in a local testing environment
  • Deploy changes to live servers
  • Assist in the remediation, enhancement, and maintenance of client sites
  • Developing reusable and maintainable web and theme components
  • Planning and issue-management via JIRA
  • Code and review PHP applications using version control
  • Deployment via Envoyer and Dependency-Management via Composer

Your Profile

  • You do live in Europe or have European Citizenship (required)
  • At least 2 years experience in PHP
  • Intermediate or expert skills in: PHP, JavaScript, WordPress
  • You are a reliable, experienced or very talented PHP Developer
  • You are passionate about web development and new technology (elegant code)
  • Experience with
    • using Git and SVN
    • working with modern dependency managers & task runners.
    • REST API / SOAP
  • You know your way around object-oriented PHP programming
  • Analytical skills as well as creative and solution-oriented thinking and working
  • Flexibility and an independent and structured way of working
  • Team-oriented behaviour and very good communication skills
  • You share your knowledge with your teammates
  • Solve client challenges with understanding and empathy
  • Provide peer reviews and share your knowledge with others
  • Solve complex problems in a simple and elegant way
  • You are eager to learn new things
  • Ability to setup local environments
  • Ability to communicate professionally with technical and non-technical colleagues and clients
  • Proficiency in verbal and written English

Optional

  • Experience with and in JIRA & Confluence
  • Remote working experience appreciated
  • Experience working for demanding or enterprise-level clients.
  • Experience with and in WooCommerce, Multisite, API integrations
  • Experience with modern PHP frameworks
  • Experience with Symfony
  • Experience with modern JavaScript/Frontend development and frameworks
  • Knowledge of relational database and non-relational database
  • Knowledge in automated testing
  • You like to work agile
  • Fluent verbal and written German skills

Date of joining

As soon as possible!
But we wait for good developers, of course.

Sounds interesting to you? Talk to us and apply Now!

Many exciting possibilities are waiting for you!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please send us your CV, salary expectations and earliest possible starting date.

Otherwise we cannot consider your application!

And again the information: Please be aware, if you do not live in Europe currently or don't have a European Citizenship, we won't consider your application!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Apply now

About Inpsyde GmbH

Inpsyde: The biggest WordPress agency in Germany

As an official “WordPress.com VIP partner” of Automattic (the company behind WordPress) and WooCommerce Gold Expert, we are leaders in demanding WordPress projects. We are the founders of the community platform WordPress Germany and have already distributed, co-designed, translated and extended WordPress in the early years. Therefore, the community, WordCamps, and core development have been an important part of our values for over 10 years.

We mainly realize large marketing sites and WooCommerce projects for medium-sized companies and international corporations.

Working at Inpsyde

Work with our great team of WordPress experts and top users on WordPress Stack Exchange. Exchange ideas, learn from them or let yourself be tempted to perform at your best as part of a team.

In contrast to ordinary employers, you will work remotely on new challenges in the WordPress world where you want – near your coffee machine, in the park or at your favourite place. This also means that you can flexibly organize your working hours.

You communicate with your colleagues via slack, hangout and zoom, while you create your own working environment with your hardware and your favourite coffee, among other things.

Or meet colleagues at WordCamps, Meetups or WooConfs worldwide to exchange ideas with other developers or to give talks on behalf of the company.

Develop WordPress plugins or websites for international companies like Facebook, SAP, Mercedes, Parship or WooCommerce extensions for e-commerce big names like PayPal. But also for medium-sized companies that do not need off-the-shelf websites or plugins.

You will also be involved in the collaboration on plugins that we make available on wordpress.org, such as BackWPup with over 7 million downloads and over 600,000 active users or MultilingualPress as the professional solution for multilingualism for WordPress and WooCommerce websites.

In small teams, a project manager and a direct line to the CEO, you can make a valuable contribution with your ideas.

Apply now! Many exciting possibilities are waiting for you!

Become an Inpsyder!
