items.title: GoDaddy: Senior Software Engineer - PHP
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=43, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer - PHP

About GoDaddy



GoDaddy powers the world's largest cloud platform dedicated to small, independent ventures. With nearly 18.5 million customers worldwide and over 77 million domain names under management, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Our mission is to give our customers the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. To learn more about the company visit www.GoDaddy.com.

GoDaddy's Sucuri organization is growing, and we are looking for a Senior PHP Developer to join our globally-distributed team! You need to be able to write clean and secure PHP code and have previous development experience with open source projects to show during the consideration process. As a PHP Developer, you will be working on the dashboard for our products and interacting side-by-side with our designers and other engineers.

This position may work remotely from any country GoDaddy has a legal presence in. This is a full-time and remote salaried position for a candidate who is comfortable with telecommuting.

The Sucuri R&D (Research and Development) team is responsible for building and maintaining our suite of security products, this includes our web site scanning engines, malware detection and clean up solutions, along with our website firewall and backups. Additionally, this includes external facing products like our blogs and website.



This is a fast-paced environment; one in which you would be pushing code live every day. Unlike most development shops where you likely have a rigid work flow and release process, ours is very lean and quick. Our environment is comprised of various languages but expertise in PHP is a must. The ability to adapt to any language will be quickly evident when working within our environment.



Technical Requirements
* 5 years of full-time development experience
* Strong knowledge of object oriented PHP
* Experience with code testing (PHPUnit)
* Experience with version control tools
* Good understanding of web architecture



Preferred skills
* Familiar with front-end technologies such as JavaScript and JQuery
* Familiar with Linux environments
* Familiar with MySQL databases



What we look for:
* Passion for technology
* You have high standards and want to make a difference with your work.
* You're ready to take on just about anything – and figure things out one way or another.
* You work well in a small team and you can convey your brilliant opinions and well-reasoned arguments without needing to   have the final say.
* You are able to work independently with little oversight.
* You have a good sense of humor.



If this positions sounds like something you think you'd be able to excel at then we want to hear from you. Please apply with your resume, in English, and let us know why you'd be awesome to work with.



#LI-JA1



GoDaddy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, creed, religion,sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, medical condition, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. GoDaddy will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local and federal requirements.

items.title: Videographer @ Y Combinator backed Dating app ($7M Series A)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Fresh off closing our $7M Series A led by Luxor Capital and Y Combinator, and as seen on the BBC home page, muzmatch is one of the fastest growing consumer startups in the UK with over 1,500,000 members. We've had some amazing press and are growing faster than ever.


As we look to DOUBLE our team, we’re looking for rockstars to join our 17+ London team in transforming how Muslims meet and marry.


Videographer


Join our fun and fast growing in house creative marketing team and help us be the biggest and best Muslim dating app out there. There are 1.8 billion Muslims out there - will you help us reach them all? This is a multi faceted role where you'll learn alot and get your hands dirty! Working closely with the team, you will be responsible for developing and growing muzmatch's long form/short form/ad video content. You will be expected to brainstorm with the team and conceptualise new ideas - overseeing productions and ongoing branded projects for brands. Shooting video, and editing content captured in both outdoor and indoor environments.




Position


Full-time




Location


London, UK








Responsibilities



  • Responsible for maintaining steady flow of video content

  • Responsible for shooting, editing and assisting in production

  • Communicating with other creatives in brainstorming and developing new ideas

  • Organise long and short form video content, working alongside our Digital Performance marketer to visualise and produce video ad creatives






Who you are



  • Must be open to new ideas and enjoy working with a creative and commercial team

  • Proficiency in video editing software tools (e.g. Adobe Premiere, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, Photoshop, Illustrator)

  • Self-motivated, creative, well-organized. Ability to problem solve and troubleshoot

  • Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment

  • Must be familiar with online and social media tools (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Wordpress)

  • A team-player able to work independently and multi-task under tight schedules.

  • Visualizing and shooting concepts effectively

  • Post production editing

  • Responsible for shooting interviews, editorial and features

  • Photoshoot planning (experience scouting locations, art direction, scheduling, lighting & renting equipment)

  • Building, and managing the photographic network

  • Experience with lighting and shooting on video, DSLRs and other HD cameras

  • Good command of both written and spoken English and must have right to live and work in UK

items.content:
FULL STACK WEB DEVELOPER – PHP / MySQL / JAVASCRIPT / MAGENTO / ZEND

JUST IN!! BRILLIANT NEW OPENING WITHIN A SOFTWARE HOUSE BASED IN NORTH WALES.

  • Seeking a full stack developer with at least 2+ years’ experience
  • Offering a salary up to £35,000 – £40,000
  • PHP / MySQL / JAVASCRIPT / MAGENTO / ZEND
  • Partial remote working available
  • To apply please call 0124 567 567 or email matthew.hardy@searchability.co.uk

Based in North Wales, we are looking for a talented full stack developer with commercial experience to join us and become a part of our in-house development team. We work closely to create brilliant resources, working with PHP / MySQL / JAVASCRIPT / MAGENTO / ZEND.

Sourced by: @TechCareers_NW – your 24/7 twitter feed of the latest IT vacancies across the North West

WHO ARE WE?
Within our specialist field, we work closely with our customers to bring effective, technological resources that are user friendly, functional and effective. We do this through best practise, sharing knowledge and the use of PHP / MySQL / JAVASCRIPT / MAGENTO / ZEND technologies. We are therefore looking for an individual with a passion for these technologies, to become the newest part of our team.

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?
By becoming the newest member of our team, you will be working on creating the best resources possible, creating work you are proud of by putting your PHP / MySQL / JAVASCRIPT / MAGENTO / ZEND skills into practise through the full development lifecycle. This opportunity will expose you to, and allow you to work with, the most modern technology on a variety of digital platforms, making this an exciting step in your career.

WE NEED YOU TO HAVE…

  • PHP / MySQL / JAVASCRIPT / MAGENTO / ZEND
  • Commercial experience coding in PHP with MVC and OO patterns
  • A genuine drive to succeed
  • A passion for technology

TO BE CONSIDERED…
Please either apply by clicking online or emailing me directly to matthew.hardy@searchability.co.uk. For further information please call me on 01244 567 567 / 07849 833665. I can make myself available outside of normal working hours to suit you. If unavailable, please leave a message and either myself or one of my colleagues will respond. By applying for this role, you give express consent for us to process & submit (subject to required skills) your application to our client in conjunction with this vacancy only. Also feel free to follow me on Twitter @SearchableMatt or connect with me on LinkedIn! I look forward to hearing from you.

KEY SKILLS:
PHP / MySQL / JAVASCRIPT / MAGENTO / ZEND

Conwy
Permanent

items.content:
Drupal Developer

Domain7 has been successfully operating out of Vancouver for the last 21 years and we are now expanding with the creation of a UK organisation.

They want to welcome a Drupal Developer into this UK organisation who can quickly build trust in forming human-friendly experiences for our new and existing clients.

We're looking for those who have a good level of technical knowledge in Drupal 8 and an appetite to delve deeper and learn more.

Developers with experience crafting robust web solutions, and authoring experiences. We're looking for people with a capacity to acquire new skills and frequently seeks out alternative solutions and techniques to improve what we create.

We are only seeking people for permanent roles at this point, based in the UK, working remotely, but with a need to travel to client and Domain7 meeting locations within the UK from time to time.

As a Junior or Intermediate Drupal Developer, you will be able to gain training and coaching from our experienced global team.

Key Duties will be:

* Build creative solutions primarily in Drupal
* Plan and create content types and data structures in Drupal
* Create themes with semantic HTML and build using tools such as grunt/gulp/wepback/postcss/sass
* Work in local environment, deploy to staging for review, and deploy work to production
* Review code from others and provide helpful feedback
* Stay on top of industry trends and techniques and share them with your colleagues
* Test new approaches to understand benefits and determine project fit
* Think through and build to performance and accessibility challenges
* Working with other disciplines: Our project teams include Strategists, Project Managers, User Experience Designers, Visual Designers, Front-End Devs, Back-End Devs, Dev-Ops, and our clients. We believe we make better work together, in collaboration

What you'll need to succeed

PHP/Drupal: Experience implementing custom plugins/modules and custom themes. Understanding of CMS APIs and standard methodologies
* Experience with Wordpress is a huge plus but knowledge of and experience with Drupal is needed for the role.
* Command Line pro: You use drush or wp-cli regularly
* GIT: feature branches, merging, rebasing.
* Javascript: Be able to build basic JS components such as mega-menus, slideshows, etc.
* CSS: Able to use SCSS and Postcss processors. Bonus if you use BEM/SMACS
* Understanding of usability and user-experience
* Understanding of accessibility
* E-commerce experience is nice to have but not required
* Bonus points for experience with Rails / PHP and working with large and complex content sites (ie. higher ed, government, large corporations, etc.)

What you'll get in return

£50,000 per annum.
Flexible / Remote Working

What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

items.content:
Full Stack (PHP/Javascript) Developer

We are seeking a senior level Laravel and React person. Can you test, build, and scale large scale applications? Do you want to be challenged every day to come up with amazing solutions to problems and be part of a team that shapes the product and architecture?

How Our Development Team Works

We’re a distributed fully remote development team, working across multiple US-based timezones. We follow an agile approach to our planning and work, including:

  • Sprint planning/estimations
  • Pair programming via Zoom & Slack
  • Code reviews
  • Weekly Show and Tell

We strive to build quality into every change that we make and as such our team uses TDD and Travis for continuous integration.  Security is also a #1 priority so we run periodic security scans on our application to ensure that our users are protected.

What We Are Looking For

You’ll need experience in modern PHP practices (via Laravel, Symfony etc), Git workflows, working with GitHub and real-world PHP and React testing experience (PHPUnit/Enzyme/Jest).

Required Qualifications: 

  • Proficiency in building RESTful APIs
  • Proficiency in developing solutions in React
  • Adaptability to a fast-paced and changing environment
  • Critical thinker
  • Embody the culture values at Breeze
  • Minimum 2+ years experience in React
  • Minimum 3+ years experience in working with PHP (Preferably in Laravel)
  • Love to experiment with the latest technologies and teach us about it
  • Take responsibility for the end product.
  • Build high-quality solutions using TDD and automated testing
  • Experience with Git & GitHub Some experience working with CodeIgniter
  • US-based and legally allowed to work full time in the US

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Degree in Computer Science
  • Infrastructure management experience

Our Tech Stack

The latest stack is:
Backend

  • Laravel (RESTful API)
  • MySQL

Frontend

  • React / React Native
  • Bootstrap 4

Development

  • GitHub Pull Request
  • Travis CI build process

Production

  • LEMP (Linux, Nginx, MySQL and PHP) in production (and LEMP via Docker in development)

Compensation

We offer a competitive salary based on experience and a full benefits package.

Apply now

items.content:
About Us


 


We are a London based tech startup and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are revolutionising the manufacturing industry by building an intelligent platform that enables product designers and engineers to get instant quotes across and instantly order custom parts.


 


We make custom manufacturing really easy!


 


We’re hard-working with a relaxed culture, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative vibe. Everyone is very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and a supportive entrepreneurial environment. We use the best bits of agile with a real focus on learning, retros , stand-ups, code reviews and plenty of chances to pair up and solve problems.


 


You’ll get first-hand experience of fundraising (we have just been backed by an extremely notable VC), rapid product development, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business.


 


When you start you’ll be able choose whatever toys you need to get the job done, a laptop, a widescreen monitor and your choice of comfy chair or standing desk. Plus 25 days holiday, a competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), and other perks.


Currently we are a small agile team, looking to recruit with immediate effect in order to scale at pace.


 


Who are we looking for?


 


We're looking for a talented, and highly-motivated Senior/Lead PHP Developer to join our team. You will be responsible for evolving and scaling our platform to enable us to revolutionise the manufacturing industry. There is a lot of scope for responsibility and the individual should be comfortable with taking ownership of [and managing] all aspects of the stack.


 


Key Responsibilities


 


• Passion and proven track record of shipping high quality web and software based projects


• Ownership of projects, issues and their resolution


• Communication of ideas, planning and progress to the rest of the team


 


What technologies are involved?


 


Over the last year we have developed platform 2.0 that is market ready, but have ambitious plans to scale and expand the offering to our users. The work will involve many greenfield projects, and also enhancements to the current platform.


 


Key Requirements


1.) Thorough knowledge of PHP and Javascript


2.) Ideally experience Leading a Team and Technical Direction of a team/startup


3.) Experience Building with Microservices Architecture


4.) Experience with TDD and/or DDD


Additional Desirable Experience within any of the below;



  • NGINX

  • WebGL/Three.JS/Java

  • Docker/Docker Compose

  • Python

  • Laravel


If you are,


1. open to an exciting challenge,


2. keen to have a real impact on our growth, and


3. believe you have what it takes - apply now!


Full time salary circa £65-80k depending on experience + Share Options


 


Benefits


• Free in-office 3D printing!


• Weekly snacks&treats


• An extra day off for your birthday


• Ability to work from home


• Competitive pay


• Generous Holiday


• A sociable team with weekly office events


• Prime location


• We get to work with the most innovative designers every single day!

items.content:
Full Stack (PHP/Javascript) Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Computer Software, CRM, Databases
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Breeze Church Management | No office location

Technologies

php
reactjs
laravel

Job description

We are seeking a senior level Laravel and React person. Can you test, build, and scale large scale applications? Do you want to be challenged every day to come up with amazing solutions to problems and be part of a team that shapes the product and architecture?

How Our Development Team Works

We’re a distributed fully remote development team, working across multiple US-based timezones. We follow an agile approach to our planning and work, including:

  • Sprint planning/estimations
  • Pair programming via Zoom & Slack
  • Code reviews
  • Weekly Show and Tell

We strive to build quality into every change that we make and as such our team uses TDD and Travis for continuous integration.  Security is also a #1 priority so we run periodic security scans on our application to ensure that our users are protected.

What We Are Looking For

You’ll need experience in modern PHP practices (via Laravel, Symfony etc), Git workflows, working with GitHub and real-world PHP and React testing experience (PHPUnit/Enzyme/Jest).

Required Qualifications: 

  • Proficiency in building RESTful APIs
  • Proficiency in developing solutions in React
  • Adaptability to a fast-paced and changing environment
  • Critical thinker
  • Embody the culture values at Breeze
  • Minimum 2+ years experience in React
  • Minimum 3+ years experience in working with PHP (Preferably in Laravel)
  • Love to experiment with the latest technologies and teach us about it
  • Take responsibility for the end product.
  • Build high-quality solutions using TDD and automated testing
  • Experience with Git & GitHub Some experience working with CodeIgniter
  • US-based and legally allowed to work full time in the US

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Degree in Computer Science
  • Infrastructure management experience

Our Latest Tech Stack
Backend

  • Laravel (RESTful API)
  • MySQL

Frontend

  • React / React Native
  • Bootstrap 4

Development

  • GitHub Pull Request
  • Travis CI build process

Production

  • LEMP (Linux, Nginx, MySQL and PHP) in production (and LEMP via Docker in development)

Compensation
We offer a competitive salary based on experience and a full benefits package.

Apply now

About Breeze Church Management

Who is Breeze?

We are a cloud-based software company making Church Software Simple. We strive, with everything we do, to be the world’s easiest web-based church management software for small and mid-sized churches. Breeze is used by more than six thousand churches to organize people, track giving, manage events and more. 

Breeze’s Core Values

These are the core values that we try to embody every day, as we interact with our customers and with each other. These are also the core values that we look for when hiring new people!

Hustle | Your drive and tenacity to get things done is unstoppable. You struggle sleeping when projects are half-finished. You can’t focus on anything else when you haven’t completed a task. You’ll do whatever it takes to cross the finish line.

Resourceful | When you don’t know an answer, you know how to find it. When there’s not a solution, you make a solution. You have the creativity it takes to find a way to get the job done.

Social Savant | You’re great with people. You can empathize and connect with them on a relational level. Your emotional intelligence is spot on, allowing you to know exactly when to open your mouth and when to close it and simply open your ears.

Servant-Minded | Your focus is on making others successful.  You're not worried about who gets the credit. You're humble and able to admit and take responsibility when you drop the ball, learning from the experience to improve next time.

Benefits

  • Medical and Dental Insurance
  • 401K Profit Sharing
  • Life and Disability Insurance
  • PTO and Holiday Pay
  • Maternity and Paternity Paid Leave

items.content:
We are looking for a Web Manager to join the Growth team in OnScale’s Glasgow office. The Web Manager will work primarily with our website, with optional projects on landing pages and help center, and is laser-focused on Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO).

The Growth team is responsible for the overall growth strategy including user acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization of our customers. The team is highly visible within the company and we work closely with marketing, sales, product and engineering to deliver impactful projects. We make data-informed decisions that drive business metrics while having fun too!

OnScale builds engineering simulation software that is used by highly technical engineers around the world. OnScale‘s product and the company are both growing quickly and there is room for career advancement within the growth team or throughout the organization.

Join a dynamic, entrepreneurial team of world-class scientists, engineers, and developers focused on building the Future of Engineering. Our team comes from BioMed, Aerospace, IoT/MEMS, RF, and many other engineering disciplines. Our plan is simple: build the world’s best computer-aided engineering platform. That means developing the best multiphysics solvers, the best optimization algorithms, the best highly-parallelized Cloud HPC system, and the best GUIs/Plugins. We thrive on accomplishment, we move fast as a team, and we’re looking for rockstars to join us.


Daily Responsibilities:

  • Manage the development of our marketing website, powered by WordPress
  • Monitor and analyse site performance (e.g. speed, traffic, conversions)
  • Participate in crafting experiments that simplify and improve a visitor’s experience
  • Actively create, track, and measure growth experiments
  • Work closely with the growth team, including sales, operations, and software engineering
  • Act as a technical partner to our strategic agencies, including SEO
  • Manage and organize incoming requests from internal stakeholders
  • Perform technical SEO (build meta descriptions, fix crawler issues etc) where necessary



Requirements

Must-Have Experience:

  • 4+ years experience at a software company or digital marketing agency
  • Proficient in HTML/CSS, XML; knowledge of SQL and JavaScript is preferred
  • Web experience testing using VWO, Optimizely, or other A/B testing software
  • Working on websites with thousands of visitors and sign-ups each month
  • History of successful experiments that increase conversion of visitor to signup
  • Ensure website security by use of SSL and firewall, and CDN
  • Adding value to other teams, including creative thinking and sharing best practices
  • Use of web analytics tools including Google Analytics, HotJar, Moz
  • BSc/BA in Computer Science, Design or a related field is preferred

Skills we seek:

  • Attention to detail and outstanding organizational skills
  • Ability to work fast and comfortable making mistakes
  • Effective and outspoken communicator
  • Working with remote team members across time zones
  • Working on a growth team, or conversion-focused web marketing team
  • An eye for pixel perfect web design, user experience, photography and digital assets

Nice to have - some, not all

  • Classic SQL Skills – Joins, Where clauses, and temp tables
  • Experience with SEO or building visitor growth organically
  • Experience with translating and multi-language websites
  • Project Management experience with Jira, Asana, or other tools
  • Your previous company sold a B2B Saas product
  • You’re interested in growth from a technical, design, or sales perspective

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary
  • Potential 15% annual bonus and equity incentive
  • 25 days annual leave
  • 10 days statutory public holidays
  • Auto-enrolment in Company pension scheme with company contribution
  • Enrolment in Company Healthcare scheme
  • Long term disability/income protection insurance
  • Perks – Meals/Snacks, Beer Fridays, Lunch-N-Learns

OnScale is an Equal Opportunity Employer OnScale is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law

Glasgow

items.content:
Full Stack Web Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Full Stack Developer
Company: SOCi | San Diego, CA

Remote details

Office Location: San Diego, CA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

lamp

Job description

About SOCi

SOCi is the leading enterprise solution for social content discovery and social media marketing. Our next-generation, all-in-one social media SaaS platform utilizes a proprietary scoring algorithm to discover, evaluate, and rank social content, changing how enterprises, franchises, and affiliates market on social media to their target audiences. SOCi has a growing team of passionate, innovative, and fun people in both our San Diego, CA and Austin, TX offices.

*This position is open to fully remote candidates

The job

  • We work collaboratively in groups of 3-4 (mobs) where you group program with other great engineers and product people, each representing different viewpoints and bringing different skills to the table.
  • Iterating and shipping daily in small increments, you're able to progress fast and have a sense of achievement every day going home.
  • Sometimes you'll need to complete other tasks and duties as needed.

You

  • Love writing elegant code.
  • Have a solid foundation of core programming skills in MySQL, PHP and JavaScript
  • Have a strong sense of visual aesthetics on web and ability to make it reality with cutting-edge CSS.
  • Shiver in horror at the thought of copy-pasting coding.
  • Have experience working in social media space (a plus).
  • Get nightmares from badly formatted code.
  • Understand that usability and attention to visual details matters just as much as good performance and clean architecture.
  • You are equally comfortable discussing database architecture as you are in debating animations and shadows in the UI all the while keeping the user story in mind to ensure you're solving the right problem.
  • Have experience working with enterprise-grade SaaS products (a plus).

What's SOCi's culture like?

Our primary driver is professional growth and learning, coupled with a desire to help our customer succeed. We focus heavily on individual mentorship and guidance, peer feedback and are always pushing ourselves and each other to the next level. We're huge on collaboration - mobing/swarming to solve problems either as individual engineering teams, or even Product/Engineering/Design leaders mobing to work out the best new product approach. We focus on moving fast, learning fast, and not looking back.

SOCi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Apply now

Full Stack Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Financial Services
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Givelify | Dallas, TX

Remote details

Office Location: Dallas, TX. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

php
node.js
angular
python
github

Job description

We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join our team with a “take no prisoners” attitude to join our team. Why is Engineering at Givelify Different: Moonshots are our norm. Our product impacts real people on the ground. We build with passion. High standard of engineering quality. Solve unique scalability challenges. You will have the ability to touch all aspects of Engineering and Product Development.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Engineering efforts in building out new features that directly impact the relationship between causes and their supporters.
  • Engineer highly available, scalable software and data architectures.
  • Build out real-time analytics and reporting dashboards that are optimized for big data and synced in real time across multiple clients.
  • Work with a small team of experienced and highly talented engineers in a CI/CD environment with cutting-edge technologies.
  • Work with our front-end team to fine tune our REST APIs.
  • Work with our DevOps team to ensure a scalable, secure, redundant, distributed production environment system.
  • Implement mathematical and machine learning algorithms under guidance from Givelify’s data scientists.

Our evolving stack:

  • Development: PHP (Yii), Node.js, Angular, Python, Spark,
  • CI/CD: Jenkins, Github, Jira, Selenium, PHPUnit

Ideal Qualifications:

  • Experience in building large scale distributed web applications.
  • Excellent object-oriented development skills.
  • Deep understanding of graph design principles with a strong background full-stack development environments.
  • Optimization of databases for big data environment, structuring of queries for fast responses.
  • Past experience in significant cross-functional engineering efforts.
  • Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g. Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google App Engine, etc.).
  • Deep understanding of big O notation and algorithm complexity analysis.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Experience leading engineering/development teams.
  • A Bachelor’s with 5+ years of experience or a M.S./Ph.D. with relevant academic/research experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent degree.
Apply now

About Givelify

From places of worship to world-changing nonprofit groups, Givelify harnesses the power of technology to bridge the gap between people & the causes they care about.  Tap. Give. Done.  

Givelify’s payment solution is designed to make the experience of giving as beautiful as the act of giving.

Benefits

  • Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Company Paid Life
  • Matching 401K
  • Paid Time Off + Paid Volunteer Time
  • Mobile Device Stipend
  • Flexible Work
  • Parental Leave
  • Professional Development
  • Fun, Purpose-Driven Culture
  • Super Tools & Tech Resources

items.content:
Senior Backend Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Marketing Software, SaaS, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: PracticeGenius | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time +/- 4 hours

Technologies

laravel
mysql
php
linux
amazon-web-services

Job description

Deeply rooted in all of us are reasons for Why we make the decisions we do. At PracticeGenius we equip thousands of businesses around the globe with tools and services that more effectively engage and align their business goals and initiatives with those of their customers, advocates, and employees. 

By combining the principles of behavioral economics and choice architecture with gamification, reward-loyalty systems, and social engagement functionality we’ve created a scalable platform that helps businesses of all sizes add contextual interactions and incentives to their most valued relationships.

Accomplishing this takes a focused effort from a talented team. Culturally we pride ourselves on the diversity that is celebrated amongst our teams and share an affinity for intelligent minds, quality work, and exceptional customer care. We have employees distributed throughout the US and offer a remote-friendly culture and flexible in-office positions.

Overview

As a Software Engineer at PracticeGenius, you’ll have a significant impact on a product used by millions of users as well as the team behind it. You’ll do this through a combination of writing code, participating in code review, collaborating remotely with engineering and non-engineering team members, and most importantly contributing your own unique experiences and perspective.

Over the last several years we've made significant strides towards improving our tech stack and engineering culture. We are committed to this as a continual journey. Some technologies you'll be working with are: Laravel (primarily JSON REST APIs), MySQL, Elasticsearch, Javascript, React/Redux, webpack, CI (continuous integration), automated testing on both frontend and backend code, automated deployments, AWS, and more.

Join us as we develop fresh new product offerings as well as help drive our continued mission of improving and replacing legacy systems, constantly adopting new technologies in an environment where you are empowered to experiment and free to fail safely.

Who Are You?

  • You care about product, think about end users, and take pride in the quality of your work.
  • Introvert or extrovert, you've got a phenomenal personality and respect for others.
  • You enjoy the constant challenges and learning that come with software development.
  • You’re not afraid to raise concerns, suggest improvements, or question the status quo.
  • You seek to learn from others as well as share your own knowledge and experience.
  • You’re a good and curious person looking to be a big part of a small team.

What Are Your Skills?

  • You are proficient in PHP (Laravel experience is a plus).
  • You are experienced and confident in managing MySQL in production.
  • You communicate effectively whether on video/audio calls or in a chat environment.
  • You can analyze a problem and break it down into small, achievable chunks.
  • You can act on feedback from others and provide helpful feedback to others.
  • You know how to contribute to and work effectively on a distributed, remote team.
  • You know how to research, explore and successfully introduce new technologies.

Examples of profiles that are relevant to us

*You’ve likely had experience that falls into one or more scenarios such as:

  • Led or played a major role in the development of a system involving multiple software developers and/or teams.
  • Held significant ownership of a software project from its early stages, through initial development, to release and maintenance.
  • Revitalized and/or replaced a legacy system with more modern, appropriate technology.
  • Built a sizable authenticated (e.g. OAuth, JWT, etc) RESTful API-based system.
  • Deployed and maintained a load balanced server environment with multiple web-servers.
  • Introduced or owned backend technologies such as ElasticSearch, Memcached, Redis, RabbitMQ, etc.
  • Identified and optimized performance issues on demanding processes, whether they were database or application code oriented.

Compensation and Benefits

  • We offer competitive salaries.
  • We offer several health benefit plans and a company funded FSA.
  • New iMac or Macbook Pro of your choice, monitors, stand up desk, and more…
  • Paid subscriptions/software to help you grow and excel (PhpStorm, Laracasts, egghead.io, Amazon books, etc...)
  • Ample paid time off, flexible work schedule, and a healthy work-life balance.
  • Remote-friendly. Our engineering team is fully distributed across the Western US. USA candidates only please.

We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender, age, and race. If you are unsure whether you meet the requirements or have any questions, please reach out and we'd be happy to help!

Well...if this all sounds good to you and you think we might have a fit, please proceed!

Apply now

About PracticeGenius

Who Are We?

PracticeGenius enjoys a fun, fast-paced and exciting corporate culture that never leaves its team members without a new problem to solve for. We pride ourselves on the diversity that is celebrated amongst our teams. Further, we’re passionate people, collectively sharing in an affinity for intelligent minds, quality of work, taking care of customers and the success that comes with it. As challenges occur, we greatly appreciate the willingness to meet and successfully overcome those moments with an open mind and positive outlook. We strive for a work-life balance and do our best to accommodate for which of the two need the center stage on any given day or week.

If this all sounds good to you and you think we might have a fit, please proceed!

What Do We Do?

With customers around the globe PracticeGenius is an emerging software-as-a-service provider specializing in customer engagement applications principally through Reward, Social, Gamification, and Contest Media technologies. Through the industry leading Patient Rewards Hub™ we offer a powerful marketing platform that is both simple to administrate while being customizable to unique business requirements. This approach provides the turn-key process, systems and tools necessary to carry out operationally friendly and financially successful marketing strategies for small-to-mid sized operators that typically lack the dedicated resources to do so.

Why We Should Work Together

PracticeGenius develops interactive patient rewards loyalty, marketing and advertising software solutions for the orthodontic market. Based out of sunny San Diego, California, Practice Genius is an emerging software solutions company leveraging the latest in technology and software.

Benefits

  • Variety of company funded healthcare plans and an FSA account
  • Work from either home or office as needed
  • Extensive PTO with paid holiday and vacation days
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Snacks & office lunches offered with read/write capabilities for both
  • Salary commensurate with role, experience, and contribution
  • We provide stand up desks, macs, multi-monitors, headsets, video etc
  • Options to attend team, industry, and customer events

items.content:
Web Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer, Full Stack Developer
Industry: Communications, SaaS
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Flocknote | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

php-7
mysql
javascript
linux
amazon-web-services

Job description

We are currently looking for somebody to fill a crucial Web Developer position here at Flocknote. It’s an important role in our company and will help shape the path forward for Flocknote.

We’re a small, startup dev team with a passion for the Church and making great things. We work hard, have fun, and are always improving. Because we’re a small shop, you must be self-motivated, able to manage your day-to-day schedule, and a very good communicator. You’ll have your hands in everything, from the data model to stylesheets, from concepts to launches, from process to implementation.

If you have a passion to help the Church, and if you enjoy dreaming up smart ways to solve problems and then watching your code come to life to make a real difference in the world, keep reading.

YOU’LL BE:

  • Co-managing technical aspects of the Flocknote service, including maintaining the health, uptime and performance of all Flocknote servers.
  • Continuing to build out Flocknote’s robust back end, including queueing & messaging systems, user management & security, data archiving, email reputation & sending, and more.
  • Integrating with multiple 3rd party services, including billing, credit card processing, short (and long) code text messaging, phone calling, Amazon SES, Amazon S3, Facebook, Twitter and others.
  • Implementing and developing new features across all areas of the stack.
  • Exterminating bugs and helping our support team make sure our customers have a great experience with Flocknote.

YOU’LL NEED:

  • To know your way around a LAMP stack.
  • To enjoy HTML, CSS, and vanilla Javascript.
  • Experience with OOP concepts and PHP (7) framework-based development.
  • Experience maintaining Linux VPS servers running Apache, PHP, and MySQL.
  • A strong knowledge of security best practices, especially as it relates to websites, including understanding of CSRF, XSS, encryption, SQL injection, etc.
  • The ability to learn quickly, multitask, and work independently in a fast-moving and dynamic environment.
  • To be a self-starter and a go-getter with extraordinary integrity.
  • To be flexible, honest, professional, easy to get along with, and enthusiastic with strong interpersonal skills.

BONUS POINTS

  • Experience developing simple iPhone and/or Android applications, using Objective-C (or Swift) and Java, respectively.
  • Experience developing cross-client email design and understanding differences in HTML layout and compatibility issues for various email clients.
  • Ability to debug performance issues using XHProf, viewing log files, and using MySQL’s EXPLAIN queries.
  • Experience with AWS.
  • Knowledge of Elasticsearch and other NoSQL datastores.

This is a full time position with salary and benefits. Telecommuting may be an option depending on the candidate.

IN ADDITION, please provide answers to the following (either in the 'Introduce yourself' section when you click to apply OR send directly to matt@flocknote.com):

  1. Very briefly tell us about you. (Not your skill set, but what makes you tick.)
  2. What is your favorite junk food and why?
  3. Please describe the nerdiest thing you’ve ever done.
Apply now

About Flocknote

At Flocknote, we are a joyful, people-first team. We focus on hiring people who, first and foremost, share the passion of our mission and our customers, and who have an unequivocal commitment to excellence, hard work, and love of neighbor. We also insist on supporting every team member’s personal priorities, recognizing that our work is not often the most important thing in each of our lives. And that only when a person’s work at Flocknote aligns in some way with their own personal dreams will they be truly happy and most productive. 

We manage our team based on good personal relationships, offering flexible schedules and a 35 hour work week, allowing people to put family first, understanding each other, and holding frequent one-on-one meetings between all levels of management and each team member. Though we are a remote company, we make in-person team gatherings a top priority. Our in-person gatherings include a little work, team service projects, live interactions with customers, and of course a little fun, too (including beach houses, axe throwing, escape rooms and more!). We also make it a point to have virtual parties throughout the year celebrating various holidays, such as Halloween, Christmas, and even National Donut Day. 

Central to our culture, we are each committed to growing in our 10 governing virtues each day and allowing them to govern our work and relationships. Our 10 governing virtues are: Humility, Veracity, Patience, Courage, Justice, Wisdom, Temperance, Faith, Hope, and Love. At every weekly team meeting, we assign a different team member to share a reflection (typically a quote or story) on one of our governing virtues.

Ultimately, we are not just coworkers, but friends, who truly care for one another and help each other to be successful and happy.

Benefits

  • 35 hour work week
  • Flexible work schedules
  • Medical/dental/vision benefits
  • Choice of the specific tech equipment you use (e.g., PC or Mac)
  • 4 weeks vacation + up to 18 company days off per year
  • Competitive salaries
  • Maternity and Paternity leave
  • We put family first

items.content:
Senior PHP Developer (Full Stack | CakePHP | Laravel | Vue | jQuery)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Online Education
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: continued | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

php
laravel
cakephp
vue.js
jquery

Job description

Location: Remote

Virtual, work-from-home position. Work anywhere in the U.S. - must be a U.S. Resident

We are growing! Join a team of 10 rockstar developers who support a company of over 90 people with industry-leading web applications in areas of subscription-based continuing education, simulation and training, ecommerce, content management, and more.

ABOUT THE COMPANY

We are continued. We are fast-paced, nimble, and laugh a lot. We all work from home offices in various locations across the country. We are dynamic, engaged, highly motivated and highly skilled. We are passionate about our work and our professions and we’re looking for another team member to join our cause. We are certified as a great workplace by the independent analysts at Great Place to Work®. Learn more about us at continued.com.

ABOUT THE TEAM

Our meetings are filled with sarcasm, laughter, and movie quotes. We share code on github and contribute back to the open source community, whenever able. Though we are virtual, we communicate a lot and have a tight-knit group. We pair, encourage test driven development, collaborate, and enjoy healthy debate here and are looking for someone who can thrive in that environment. A thirst for knowledge and passion for solving problems is what drives the team. Training and education is a big part of who we are, not only as a company, but also as a mindset. We keep up to date in our field via continuing education, conferences, etc.

ABOUT THE POSITION

We are seeking an innovative and engaged Senior PHP developer who is motivated, creative, and fun to assist in developing our custom CakePHP and Laravel web applications.

  • Full-Time, 8a-5p in your time zone
  • Work from your home office
  • Company-provided MacBook Pro, Internet stipend, etc
  • Must be located in the United States and be legally eligible to work for us
  • Travel is required for an annual company meeting, and may be required once or twice per year for team or project meetings

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Minor and major application feature development
  • Assist stakeholders in developing feature specifications
  • Plan, code, test, and deploy new features/applications/projects/modules/plugins
  • Troubleshoot application bugs and determine resolutions
  • Optimize and refactor existing code to improve performance and reliability [http://goo.gl/Kp3W3]
  • Suggest improvements, security needs, best practices, etc (your voice will be heard)

REQUIREMENTS

Self-management and time management are critical in this role. Without it, you will not be successful. Other requirements include:

  • 7+ years experience with PHP, Modern Backend Framework (CakePHP, Laravel, Symfony, etc.), Modern Front End Framework (Vue, jQuery, Angular, etc.), HTML5, SASS & CSS
  • A communication pro - must be able to explain technical issues to a non-technical person, pleasantly (we are always on Skype with stakeholders)
  • Comfortable with writing, editing, and maintaining Unit/Feature tests
  • Highly attentive to details, able to cross all the t's and dot all the i's and help review/fix others
  • There is direct project oversight, but you are expected to take ownership of your work and your projects, establish deadlines, and communicate progress proactively
  • Eager to research and learn in a self-directed way (always improving)
  • Easygoing, fun, and a team player - must be able to comprehend highly-advanced forms of sarcasm
  • A home office, free of distractions, with a high-speed Internet connection
  • Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD)

PREFERRED, BUT NOT REQUIRED

Although not required, the ideal candidate would also have:

  • Bachelor's Degree (or higher) in Computer Science
  • An active github account with open source contributions
  • A well thought out preference for Star Wars or Star Trek
  • Working knowledge of xkcd comic strip or similar

We prefer a great/interested/excited programmer with less experience to an unmotivated or unengaged programmer with tons of experience.

TO APPLY

Submit a cover letter with your resume that includes 1) why you would make a great addition to our team; 2) a favorite clip from youtube; and 3) your salary requirements. Submissions without this information will not be considered.

Apply now

Benefits

  • 21 Days of Paid Time Off per Year + Your Birthday and Holidays
  • Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, STD, LTD, Life Insurance and more
  • 401k with 100% match of up to 3% of salary, fully vested immediately
  • Charitable Gift Matching
  • Work From Home, regular business hours
  • Macbook Pro and all applicable software
  • Internet service stipend
  • Wellness Program and $300/yr reimbursement
  • Strong culture of Collaboration and Humor

Senior Drupal Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer, Full Stack Developer
Industry: Artificial Intelligence, Digital Video Distribution, Higher Education
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Ocelot | Evanston, IL

Remote details

Office Location: Evanston, IL. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

drupal
drupal-8
symfony
mysql
drupal-7

Job description

Student debt and access to education are critical issues of our time. We help students and colleges succeed. You can make a major impact. Deliver on technology products that students and colleges want. Be an early member of the technology portion of our team. Learn and experience as this growing and profitable company delivers. Architect, execute and contribute. Work closely with our crack team of technologists, industry experts, and entrepreneurs.

Ocelot utilizes a wide range of open-source technologies to deliver top notch products to our clients including Node.js, React, Next.js, Drupal, MongoDB, Solr, and MySQL.

While working at Ocelot you will be challenged to architect, build, and maintain the software components that are critical to our success. Drupal is at the core of our tech stack and we are dedicated to giving back. Over the past months as we have migrated to Drupal 8, we have developed several modules that will be headed to contrib later in the year. Your contributions at Ocelot will impact the lives of students and administrators at colleges and universities as well as serve the Drupal community as a whole.

Ideal candidates are enthusiastic about the latest web technologies and are excited to bring their expertise to the table to improve our products.  We are a small team that relies on strong communication and a can-do attitude.

This position is available for remote, or for on-site at our Evanston, Illinois based office.

Required Qualifications

  • Passion for problem solving
  • 5+ years of PHP experience
  • 3+ years of Drupal experience including Drupal 8
  • Skilled with modern databases (MySQL, Redis, and MongoDB)
  • Proficient with modern front-end web technologies and techniques: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Responsive design
  • Proficient in use of development tools including Git and JIRA
  • Strong communication skills, team player

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with React.js
  • Experience developing real-time applications
  • Experience developing and deploying on containers
Apply now

About Ocelot

Ocelot is an award-winning content and technology company based in Boulder, Colorado.  Since 2003, we have been providing colleges and universities with self-service products to help students navigate the college experience.  

Our core products include an interactive educational counseling platform, an extensive educational video library, and an artificially intelligent chatbot for financial and and student services departments.

Benefits

  • Health Insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Casual Work Environment
  • Close to Public Transportation
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Gigabit Internet
  • Flexibile Hours

items.content:
Outdoors/Fishing Tips Website Writer Wanted Full Time

Company: Ecom Elites
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Full-time
Description

We are looking for someone to join our writing team full time.

PLEASE READ THIS CAREFULLY! We don't want to waste your time as we are looking for a specific writer.

  • Write 3000+ words a week. Prefer people who can write more.. have someone doing 5000+ a week at the moment.
  • Actually knows how to write content (we see a lot of bad content)
  • Knows how to use WordPress (you will be uploading and posting)
  • Must be able to write correctly and this means fluent in english.
  • Understand what google wants and knows how to structure content.

The job...

You will be sent topics and you will need to write about them and post on our WordPress blog. You will do all the research on the topic.

Niche: Outdoor/Fishing

We write mostly about fishing tips. We also do product reviews so you must know how to do this type of stuff. This is also an amazon affiliate site so experience in amazon affiliate products structure is a must as well.

Examples...

You must send real examples of yours and no anyone else's examples.

Price...

Must include your price per 100 words when applying.

We don't reply to anyone who we don't think is the right fit so please when you apply put thought into it. You are getting hired for a writing job so it would be wise to do a good job at writing to us when you apply.

We pay via PayPal only and contact via Slack or Skype only.

Thanks

Application Instructions
Must send past examples
Must send price per $100 words

items.content:
We're looking for Senior talent that understands the broad architecture of the entire system and will deliver functional, complex products with minimal direction and oversight. You'll provide technical knowledge and leadership to the engineering team, and will weigh in on technical decisions that impact teams or the company at large.

What We Need you to Do:

* Develop high-quality software solutions by studying information needs, interfacing across the organization, investigating problem areas, studying system flow, and following the SDLC.
* Make other engineers better through code reviews, thorough documentation, technical guidance, pair programming, and mentoring or serving as a Technical Lead on a project.
* Ability to pick up new technology quickly and adapt in a growth environment.
* Deliver software on-time, in scope, and make accurate estimates.

What You Already Posess Walking through the Door:
* Progressive experience as an SE for five or more years.
* Developing enterprise software. Specifically, extensive experience creating readable and testable code.
* Experience working in a team environment using agile sprint methodologies and tools including Jira, Git, and Slack.
* Proven understanding of architectural design patterns and the proper use cases associated with each.
* Experience integrating/consuming RESTful APIs.

Even Better If You Have...
* Healthcare domain knowledge
* Integration platform as a service

STACK:

* Elixir
* PHP, Laravel 5+ framework
* Vue, Nuxt
* RabbitMQ
* Postgres
* GraphQL
* Redis
* Containerization (Docker, K8s)
* TDD/BDD
* Service oriented architecture
* Git Flow
* Object oriented programming
* Functional programming

items.title: Software Developer (Games Company) - Concept Gaming LTD - Cardiff
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=26, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Summary

Concept Gaming is a games development company to the online Casino and Sports Betting industry. Based in Cardiff, the company supplies games to global Casino operators.

In 2017 Concept Gaming recruited its first programmer from the National Software Academy and now has a new opening in 2019.

The Role

The primary focus for the new candidate will be to learn how to support and develop our Tournament gaming system.

The the new candidate will also work towards integrating the Concept Gaming games platform into Casino Operators systems, thus allowing the Concept Gaming product range to be playable on the partners gaming websites.

The platform is an integration layer between the game engines and the client’s, (Operators) who use them. A client exposes their API to us which allows us to call methods on their system that in turn allows us to interact with the player's account, such as removing or adding to their balance.

Responsibilities and Duties

You would be tasked with implementing the partner company's API into our platform using our integration interface.

However, there could be scope for you also to work on software such as new Game Engines and help provide technical support for our existing platform / games engines.

Qualifications and Skills

Technical Requirements (although not all essential as you could grown and learn into the role)

- Docker

- A very minimal understanding of docker would be nice, but isn't required.

- PHP

- The developer should understand PHP and basic programming constructs and principles

- An understanding of Composer and Laravel would also be nice, but not required.

- HTTP

- The developer should understand the fundamentals of HTTP requests such as the different HTTP verbs.

- The developer should be familiar with API design paradigms relating to HTTP such as REST.

- Database (RDBMS)

- The developer should understand basic SQL queries. (We use MySQL as the implementation of our RDBMS)

- Reverse Engineering

- The developer should ideally be able to understand existing code with and without comments. - Documentation- It is an absolute must, that the developer be able to read and understand clearly written documentation.

Additional roles will include:

  • Provide support of existing Concept Gaming / Operator integrations
  • Set-up new Concept Gaming platform instances on new servers as an when required
  • New software developments

We want to hear from someone passionate about learning on the job and getting into a very exciting industry!

Benefits

This is a flexible full time position where the right candidate can grow into the role based on performance and each sides needs . As such we are prepared to start the role with someone working around their college hours and at weekends if they are still a student. Work would be from our Cardiff Bay office, but in time could also be remote using our remote developer software tracker.

Remuneration:

To be discussed.

Job Type: Contract

Cardiff
Contract

items.title: Senior PHP Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Rebilly

Senior PHP Developer

We are looking for a tenacious, passionate, creative, software-driven individual to guide the design and development of our subscription billing software. **OBJECTIVE #1 Take on a project and see it to its end.** - Potential Obstacles: We have many projects running and in a self-managed, remote environment, it’s tempting to pick up a new project (or three) before your first project is completed. - Actions: Understand the value of completions and use your tenacity to carry each project to the very end. - Results: Your project completion numbers in Jira are stellar and you have concentration available for the handful of projects on your plate. **OBJECTIVE #2 Work as a synchronous team in a remote environment.** - Potential Obstacles: Working remote has many personal and team-based challenges from timezone differences, to communication and trust of your colleagues. - Actions: Develop deep working relationships with your colleagues to know what they’re working on, and how to support each other. - Results: The team culture is strong, Rebilly’s bigger projects efficiently move forward. **OBJECTIVE #3 Help your colleagues raise their skills with thoughtful code reviews and feedback on ideas.** - Potential Obstacles: Your day will be filled with your own projects and priorities, and offering feedback to a remote team from afar can be intimidating. - Actions: Prioritize your schedule and share your unique knowledge and experience to help make your team stronger. - Results: Your team is more precise, creative, and their knowledge is deepened with your help. **KEY FUNCTIONAL AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY** - What will you manage? Each teammate at Rebilly manages themselves, which means you get to pick the projects you work on. Along with that, you’ll be responsible for ensuring adherence to programming and documentation policies, code standards, testing, release, and reporting updates on your projects. - What will you contribute to? You will contribute to code reviews, feedback for ideas (including the ideas for other areas of the company), and hiring new teammates in the Product Team. - What will you support? Outside of generally supporting your teammates in the Product Circle, Rebilly is an open environment where everyone is welcome in every area of the company. You are welcome to support any project you feel called to participate in. - How much support per project? You can ask as many teammates to join your project as you need to complete the mission. **SOME OF THE PROJECTS WE ARE WORKING ON** - Customer Billing Portal - create a secure and highly customizable customer billing portal - Auth Service - decompose the monolith application into loosely coupled services - Metered Billing - ongoing development of our billing solutions - Automation - integration with small business software - Dashboards - create reporting API’s for our clients' dashboards **APPLY!** Please send your resume through Apply By API: [https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/7/](https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/7/) **HIRING PROCESS** - Apply By API* - [https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/7/](https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/7/) - Small code challenge (unless you have extensive open source contributions) - Interview with the Product Team - Interview with the Product Team Lead - Offer and Hiring The total process should take less than 2 weeks. *We are only accepting applications through ApplyByAPI at this time. **WORKING AT REBILLY** Check us out at [https://www.rebilly.com/careers/](https://www.rebilly.com/careers/) Rebilly offers a competitive salary, training and development, birthday lunches, and provides the computer of your choosing. You are welcome to work out of our Montreal office, remotely out of Austin (occasionally meeting with our team here for lunch or happy hour, otherwise set up as a 100% remote/work from home environment), or anywhere on the globe that you choose as a fully remote employee. Further perks and benefits are dependent on your work location of choice. Rebilly is a Teal Organization, meaning our organizational structure may differ than what you’re used to, but we think you’ll be pleasantly surprised. In a very tiny nutshell, this means that as an organization we value self-management, self-organization, as well as the wholeness of the individuals that make up our team (meaning you should be yourself at work, and do the work that inspires you.) **ABOUT REBILLY** Rebilly is subscription billing software that helps businesses who need to handle recurring invoices and payments. Rebilly’s comprehensive feature set is built to help our merchants get more of their customers from the order form to the thank you page, and more renewals paid. We took lessons learned from years of experience in the subscription business and millions of subscribers and applied them to make our payment system clever, flexible, and easy to use for our clients.

items.title: Senior WordPress Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=40, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
Senior WordPress Developer at AdTaxi Networks

Remote

Job Locations: US-CO-Denver

Requisition ID: 2019-2174

Time Type: Full-Time

Employment Type: Regular

Overview

We want to be the best. That’s why we hire the best. As the 2018 winner of Digiday’s Worklife Award for Most Passionate Employees at an Agency, we thrive on challenging, rewarding, purpose-driven work. We’re looking for skilled individuals like you – for professionals full of talent, but not of themselves.

Adtaxi is a client-centric digital organization that brings scale, precision, and sophistication to digital marketing. Leveraging the belief that people matter as much as technology, we help advertisers solve complex marketing challenges with custom, performance-driven solutions.

We are a Facebook Small Business Solutions Partner, a Google Premier Partner, and the recipient of the 2016 Google Channel Sales Innovator Award – US; this prestigious award, the only one in the innovation category presented to a U.S. company, recognizes the leading-edge technology of our Quantum Optimization Platform.

Responsibilities

The MNG Digital Product & Development team is leading the company’s digital transformation through strategic new initiatives focused on how news content gets distributed, how communities engage with DFM news properties, and how revenue is generated in an industry undergoing rapid change.

We are seeking a strong, highly creative WordPress Developer to be part of the team as we continue to create new news sites and advanced features on our in-house built WordPress VIP content management system. This person will be intellectually curious, eager to learn about news media and how technology can help chart its future course, and, in general, through collaboration and participation with other developers, product managers, and others, improve the organization as a whole.

Specifically, the Developer will:

  • Be ready, willing, and able to think through complex problems, help fix them, mentor and support others, think outside the box and ask questions.
  • Have strong experience and understanding in PHP, the WordPress Framework and WordPress REST API.
  • Have a minimum understanding of all of the following, and be able to demonstrate working knowledge in most of it:
  1. Object Oriented Programming
  2. Software design patterns
  3. JavaScript
  4. React/Redux
  5. Experience with GraphQL helpful
  6. MYSQL
  7. PHP
  8. NOSQL
  9. CSS3
  10. HTML5
  11. REST Services
  12. GIT Version Control
  13. Command Line $BASH etc.
  14. Web server technology – Apache, NGINX or similar
  15. Experience with Document Object Model (DOM) and Regex helpful
  • Work closely with a team of product and development experts to ideate, design, and develop a variety of next generation news and advertising products
  • Resolve site issues and oversee testing associated with maintenance and measuring success metrics
  • Carry out other duties as may be assigned or requested

Qualifications

  • Has a minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience in the field or in a related area
  • Detail oriented, well organized, able to thrive in deadline driven environment while working on a number of projects simultaneously and independently.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Experience with consumer-facing web sites and user experience.
  • Proven expertise in third-party integrations.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment helpful, but not required.
  • Experience with Chrome/Firefox debugger and development tools helpful.
  • Grow expertise by proactively remaining current with trends within digital media technologies.

Additional information:

This is a full-time, salaried position, W-2 only (no corp to corp). Position based in Denver, CO, but will consider remote applicants on a case by case basis.

Apply for job

items.title: RELAYTO Developer Internprenuer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
WHAT IS RELAYTO/?


RELAYTO/ is the first publishing tool for interactive documents. It revolutionizes how any individual or organization creates and shares knowledge with their audience, and measures impact. It gives you simple, slick, and smart features to communicate with your colleagues, prospects, and customers. Think Squarespace for documents - proposals, presentations, reports, emails and more - no design or coding needed.


Check out some of the reasons we think it's a game-changer for professionals and businesses.


AM I A GOOD FIT?
You are not an average intern looking to claw your way to middle management at a bank for the next 10 years. You are an internpreneur: a hacker or designer, journalist or marketer, idea person or data quant, MBA candidate with years of experience or university student looking for their first gig.


An internpreneur approaches their career like an entrepreneur: able and eager to get things done and innovate with limited resources. You think ahead and want to learn how companies and careers grow before jumping in the deep end of the entrepreneurial/career pool entirely on your own. What else?



  • You are able to execute in startup time and independently figure out things that are entirely new

  • You believe business can make the world a better place (while keeping an eye on the bottom line)

  • You want to improve the business world - and yourself

  • You have experience in one or more of the following technologies: Javascript / PHP / MongoDB

  • Willingness to learn one or more of the following technologies: Angular.js / Symfony2 / Docker



WHAT CAN RELAYTO/ DO FOR ME?


Re-think grad school: gain an education, experience, and amazing connections.


If you're not ready to launch your own venture or don't quite know who you want to be professionally, we are a great foundation. Get in on the ground floor of an awesome and innovative company.


If you are curious about the specific role - reach out to us. But broadly speaking, the range of opportunities and responsibilities include:



  • Define customer needs and usability specs. Be the champion of our users

  • Craft breakthrough designs and architecture

  • Build solutions. Find and create best practices templates for key activities in computer science, UI/UX, user feedback, etc.

  • Build and test new product prototypes. Get instant feedback

  • Depending on your professional goals and RELAYTO's needs, this internship would be designed to balance your learning with specific business requirements


WHY GET EXCITED?



  • A big vision product that’ll improve how people and groups create, communicate and work together, with potential appeal to everyone who wants to share knowledge or learn.

  • An experienced, proven team that has previously built and sold the largest business applications in the cloud and on the desktop.

  • Exciting product challenges, in both architecture, product management and user experience.

  • A team that gives the opportunity to young talent and values the diversity of experience and perspective.

  • A driven set of individuals that genuinely enjoy working with one another: solving problems; refining designs; creating, learning and growing together.

  • A jerk-free culture defined by trust, respect, and empathy.

  • A company that’s advised by some of the smartest experts in the business.


WHERE AND WHEN?


Meet us in some of the coolest cities in the world or work remotely.


We are a location-free startup, currently spanning London, Paris, Johannesburg & San Francisco. We encourage flexibility and opportunity for working virtually or in physical teams, depending on your preference. The primary location for in-person meetings will be San Francisco, London and Paris.


We require at least a 20 hours/week commitment from interns working remotely during the school year.

items.content:
Backend Drupal Developer (Zürich or Remote CET)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Web Design, Web Development, Web Hosting
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Amazee | Zürich, Switzerland

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Amsterdam +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Zürich, Switzerland. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

drupal
graphql
php
mysql
drupal-8

Job description

We are currently looking for an experienced Backend Drupal Developer to join our Zurich team. As part of the Amazee Labs team, you will be building the underpinning for our ambitious client projects using modern web technologies. In addition to working with established tools like Drupal 8, you will be able to work and experiment with bleeding edge technologies like React, Vue.js or GraphQL. 

Responsibilities

  • Build, extend, and configure Drupal sites using core and contrib modules.
  • Engineer and develop backend solutions to meet client requirements.
  • Collaborate with other engineers and clients.

Requirements

  • Strong background in PHP, MySQL and JavaScript.
  • Extensive Drupal knowledge and experience.
  • Drupal 8 knowledge and experience.
  • Experience working collaboratively using version control (Git).
  • Proficient in English, both spoken and written.
  • An active player in the Open Source community (high level of commitment and contribution).

Plus

  • Knowledge of GraphQL (and Relay or Apollo).
  • Knowledge and experience with React or Vue.js
  • Experience in automated testing of JavaScript applications.
  • Node.js experience.
  • Experience with Webpack and other build tools.
  • Agile and Scrum experience.

Work Location

Our office in Zurich, or remote within the Central European time zone.

We offer

  • Exciting and challenging projects.
  • Biennial soft and hardware budget.
  • The opportunity to take one month off to do something extreme, after three years of full-time employment.
  • Attendance of DrupalCons and Camps. Annual education and fitness budgets.

If you are excited about the opportunity to join an international digital agency and think you will be a good fit, we would love to hear from you. Please send your CV, portfolio and a cover letter telling us about your work experience, as well as some interesting details about yourself. We are looking forward to meeting you!

Apply now

About Amazee

Amazee Labs is a leading global Drupal and React agency with a passion for engaging web design. Our services include web consulting, web development as well as hosting and maintenance. We excel in the areas of web design, user experience and high performing websites. We’re a young and dynamic team, working with international clients and companies of varying sizes and industries.

Benefits

  • Bi-annual soft and hardware budget
  • Attend Conferences and Camps
  • Annual education budget
  • Annual fitness budget
  • After three years you get one month off to do something extreme
  • Young and international team
  • Possibility to work remotely
  • Possibility to work from other Amazee Hubs
